En la actualidad quieren el crédito para comprar insecticidas y fertilizantes para tener una buena producción agrícola, requieren de mucha urgencia los insecticidas porque sus cultivos tienen mucha plaga y se están dañando.

Este crédito es para comprar fertilizantes e insecticidas. Lleva 4 ciclos en el banco comunal, es la presidenta del banco y le gusta por la ayuda que les han dado con los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son comprar un carro y tener su casa con todos los servicios básicos.
texts.en:
The two men and nineteen women members of Los Álamos Communal Bank meet every two weeks in the city of Charapoto, province of Manabí.  Most of them work in agriculture and raising animals.  This town is known for its traditional culture and for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.
 
One of the members of this group is Yexi.  She is 34 years old and is in a common-law union from which she has four children, ages 12, 10, 9, and 5.  The three older children study, one in high school and two in elementary school.  Her husband is a farmer.

Like the good wife that she is, she is getting the loan to use it with her husband in agriculture.  During the winter season they grow corn, peanuts, and certain vegetables, and then in the summer her husband works buying and selling charcoal, which he goes out to sell to certain restaurants and roast chicken places where they use this material a lot to cook the food.

Currently they want the loan to buy insecticide and fertilizer to have a good farm crop.  They need  the insecticides urgently because their crops have lots of pests and they are being harmed.

This loan is to buy fertilizer and insecticide.  She has been with the communal bank for four cycles.  She is the president of the bank and she likes it because they have given her the loans.

Her dreams are to buy a car and to have her house with all the basic services.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Daysi Janeth

texts.es:
En el cantón Olmedo de la Provincia de Manabí cada quince días  se reúne el Banco Comunal Esfuerzo y Poder, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 

Aquí conocimos a la señora Daysi, tiene 52 años  de edad, es madre soltera de una  hija de 16 años que estudian en colegio. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal, es la presidenta del grupo y le gusta porque sus compañeras son  muy unidas y confiables.

Ella tiene un almacene  el centro del cantón en el cual vende de todo un poco, en su local sus clientes encuentran electrodomésticos, platos, colchones, bisutería, ropa, pañales entre otros muchos productos, allí trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00, en ciertas ocasiones su hija le ayuda en su trabajo cuando está desocupada.  Lleva más de 15 años con su local y  gracias a este negocio ha podido sacar adelante a su hija.

Este crédito es para surtir su negocio comprar bisutería, electrodomésticos, ropa, entre otros productos. 

Su sueño es que su hija sea profesional.
texts.en:
Esfuerzo y Poder Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Olmedo Canton in the province of Manabí.  This place is known for its pretty landscapes and the hardworking people who work in agriculture and raising animals.

This is where we met Daysi.  She is 52 years old and the single mother of a 16-year-old daughter who studies in high school.  She is a founding member of the communal bank.  She is the president of the group and she likes it because her companions are very close and dependable.

She has a department store in the center of the canton where she sells a little of everything.  In her place her customers find household appliances, plates, cushions, costume jewelry, clothing, and diapers, among many other products.  She works there every day from 8:00 until 5:00.  Sometimes her daughter helps her in her work when she is not busy.  She has had her place for more than 15 years, and thanks to this business she has been able to get her daughter ahead.

This loan is to stock her business, to buy costume jewelry, household appliances, and clothing, among other products.

Her dream is that her daughter will be a professional.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry, household appliances, clothing, etc.

loans.name: Leonid

texts.ru:
Леонид с семьей живет в Водяном. Он занимается выращиванием ранних овощей, редиса, огурцов и помидор в теплицах. У Леонида есть большой участок земли, три большие теплицы 60х9 метров и две отдельные теплицы для рассады. Фермерством он занимается уже 8 лет. В хозяйство вложено 100 000 гривен. Затраты на семена и пленку составляют 36 000 гривен ежегодно. 

Леониду необходим кредит КИВА в размере 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить пленку на 4 000 гривен, семена на 5 000 гривен и удобрения на 1 000 гривен. Полученные заемные средства помогут Леониду вовремя натянуть пленку и накрыть теплицы, пока не сильно холодно, чтобы начать сеять семена. Леонид вкладывает полученную прибыль в улучшение жилищных условий в собственном доме – недавно они сделали хороший ремонт, смогли сделать ванну и туалет в доме. Осенью Леонид планирует провести хорошее отопление в доме, для чего ему понадобятся дополнительные средства.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Leonid and his family live in Vodyanoye.  He grows early vegetables, radishes, cucumbers, and tomatoes in greenhouses.  Leonid has a large piece of land, three large greenhouses (60 x 9 meters) and two separate greenhouses for seedlings.  He has been farming for eight years.  There are 100,000 hryven (UAH) invested in his farm.  Every year the cost of seed and greenhouse film comes to 36,000 hryven. 

Leonid needs a loan through Kiva of 10,000 hryven to buy 4,000 hryven worth of greenhouse film, 5,000 hryven worth of seed, and 1,000 hryven worth of fertilizer.  The borrowed funds will help Leonid to cover and tighten the film on his greenhouses, while it still isn't very cold, so he can begin to sow seed.  Leonid will invest the profit he earns in improving the living conditions in his home.   Not long ago, they finished a good renovation of their house and were able to install a bath and toilet.  This autumn, Leonid is planning to install good heating in the house which is why he will need to have the additional income.

Note: story in Russian

loans.use: to buy 4,000 hryven worth of greenhouse film, 5,000 hryven worth of seed, and 1,000 hryven worth of fertilizer

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is the mother of seven children with the two youngest still of school age. She says she has been taking care of her family with her farming income for the last nine years. Her farm currently produce milk and eggs that she sells in the local market. As with other farmers, she concurs that animal diseases remain the major challenge in farming.

Hellen has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, which she will use to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says this will boost her dairy income and ease her burden in providing for the family’s basic needs. She hopes to increase the number of her cows to four.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Yrene

texts.en:
Yrene belongs to a village bank called “Señor de Accha.” The bank is located in Pisac, a district of Calca province in the Cusco department. Yrene is 33 years old and has one child with her partner. In order to support her family, Yrene sells artisan products in the local arts and crafts market, primarily to tourists who are visiting nearby Macchu Picchu. Popular keepsakes include colorful hand-woven textiles and an assortment of winter knits made from alpaca fleece.

Yrene is requesting a loan in order to purchase handicrafts for her stand, which will allow her to offer a better selection to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase handicrafts for a souvenir stand.

loans.name: Moria

texts.en:
Moria is a 32-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has four children between the ages of 1 year and 7 years; two of them go to school. 

Moria runs a roofing-poles business; he has been in the business for six years. He has one employee. Moria heard about Finance Sudan through outreach and promotion done in the market by the officer. He is taking a loan of 3,500 Sudan pounds to purchase more roofing poles. In additions to this business, Moria has no other source of income. 

In five years time, Moria would like to hope for incremental increases in the business size and also to have a better house. 

His major challenges include his low income rate and feeding issues only.

Moria says a lot of thanks for giving Finance Sudan support in South Sudan.

loans.use: to purchase more roofing poles.

loans.name: Los Excelentes 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Francisca is the coordinator of her group Los Excelentes 1 & 2, which is composed of 10 micro-entrepreneurs located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris. Their community is a rural area outside of the city. 

Francisca sells underwear. She and the other members are doing business in their community and the nearest ones by walking.

Francisca is a hardworking mother with four children. Her most important challenges are to work hard to provide for her family and to help her long-term partner with extra income. 

She is receiving her fourth loan from Esperanza Internacional and she is committed to working harder to improve her business. Francisca would like to save her profits to reinvest in her business. She wants to be a wholesaler and sell to other sellers. The 10 members of the group are shown in the two pictures taken in their community.

loans.use: to buy underwear.

loans.name: Pura Soveida

texts.es:
En el cantón Olmedo de la Provincia de Manabí cada quince días  se reúne el Banco Comunal Esfuerzo y Poder, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Pura, tiene 57 años de edad, está separada de su esposo pero de esta relación tienen tres hijos, los mismos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes.
 
Para salir adelante ella se dedica al comercio, para lo cual instala un pequeño local en una de las vías del cantón donde les permiten a otros comerciantes vender sus productos, allí ella también vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatos, zapatillas y todo tipo de bisutería, trabaja todos los días desde hace mas de 24 años y gracias a su negocio pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos sola ya que se  separo hace muchos años y desde allí tuvo que hacerse cargo de sus hijos. 

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos y bisutería y así surtir aun más su negocio. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho.
 
Sus sueños son tener buena salud y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Esfuerzo y Poder Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Olmedo Canton in the province of Manabí. This place is known for its pretty landscapes and its hardworking people, who work in agriculture and raising animals.

Here we met Pura.  She is 57 years old and separated from her husband, but from this relationship they have three children who are already adults and independent.

To get ahead she works in sales, for which she sets up a little place on one of the thoroughfares in the canton, where they allow other vendors to sell their products.  There she also sells all types of clothing, shoes, sneakers, and all types of costume jewelry.  She has worked every day for more than 24 years and thanks to her business she managed to get her children ahead, because she was separated many years ago and, since then, she had to take charge of her children.

This loan is to buy clothing, shoes, and costume jewelry and so stock her business even more.  She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because the loans have helped her a lot.

Her dreams are to have good health and to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Minerva Mirabal 1 Group

texts.en:
Maura is one of the members of 'Minerva Mirabal group 1' (named after one of the legendary Mirabal sisters who resisted and were killed by the dictator Trujillo). Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. These five women are dedicated to working hard and developing their business to bring changes to their families. 

She makes her home here in a simple structure with her three children. Maura is excited to be taking out her 6th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She runs a business selling bacon and sausage and this loan is to invest in purchasing pork and beef to prepare salted meat and pork sausage. She will use the profits to cover her home expenses and to reinvest in her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy pork and beef

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is the father of three children aged between fifteen and twenty-seven. His youngest child is still in school. He is a farmer in his rural home in Kitale, Western Kenya and has employed one farmhand to assist with selling his milk and tea at the local market. He also runs a retail shop to supplement his farming income.

Patrick has requested a loan of 58,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a flock of poultry for 30,000 KES and a chuff cutter (a machine that cuts stovers, or the leaves and stalks of maize, sorghum or soybean plants, into smaller pieces for fodder) for 28,000 KES. He is worried about the fluctuation in market prices, especially within the local markets. He hopes, however, to earn more from his dairy through providing his cows with better feed and reducing its waste.

loans.use: to buy poultry and a chuff cutter.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is 45 years old, single, and runs multiple businesses. In the photo, Doris is pictured in her shop where she sells artisanal handicrafts and souvenirs. Doris also runs a restaurant, where passersby can count on her assortment of snacks and beverages to satisfy their cravings.

Doris belongs to a village bank called “Señor de Accha.” The bank is located in Pisac, a city within Calca province in the Cusco district. Doris is requesting a 1000 PEN loan in order to buy food and beverages for her restaurant. The loan will help Doris maintain the necessary inventory in order to sustain and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages for her restaurant.

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.en: Maria Rosa is 40 years old, married and lives with her family in Quito, Ecuador.  Always the hard worker, Maria Rosa began raising hamsters, something her mother taught her, about a year ago in order to help her family make ends meet. After doing this for a while, she decided to try for a loan for the first time in order to buy some pigs, something she hopes will increase her income significantly.  Her dream is to eventually own enough pigs to have a full-fledged pig farm, something that can help secure a good life for her and her family.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a single man, aged 22. He lives in Litein with his parents in their rural home where he has practiced farming for five years. He produces tea, which he sells locally. Besides farming, he retails tea at the local market with his tea being sourced both from his farm and from other farmers.

Robert has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo and says he will buy a dairy cow and venture into dairy farming. He adds that he will use the income to build a strong foundation for his future family as well as to improve the living standards of his parents.

He notes, however, that local markets have little reward for farmers, and the farmers must find ways to access external markets.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama lives near Elmina, Ghana in the town of Eguafo. She is married to a farmer and has six dependents. Ama has been a fish monger for four years now; she also sells kenkey. Ama uses her income to help pay her family’s utility bills.

Ama will use her loan of 600 GHS from CRAN to purchase fish to fry for sale and bags of maize to prepare her kenkey to sell. With increased profits Ama wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish and bags of maize.

loans.name: Nzambi

texts.en:
Nzambi is an enterprising 54 year old businesswoman.  She is married to Peter, a farmer, and is blessed with nine children.  She has been selling ropes for the past six years, and earns a monthly income of KES 2,300, which she uses to support her family.

Nzambi is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD after being introduced to the organization by an existing KADET customer.  She will use the loan to buy more sisal for making ropes. The profits will be used to educate her children. She dreams of opening a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy more sisal for making ropes.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 30 year old retail shop proprietor in Mariakani. She is single. Her business has been in operation for the past three years and it is doing great. 

This is her first business loan from KADET to finance her business. She plans to purchase more sugar, rice, cooking oil and washing detergent. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business further and repay her loan. She hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, rice, cooking oil and washing detergent

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 35 year old lady from Homabay town, in western Kenya.  She is married to Geofrey, and they have children aged six, nine and twelve years.

Caroline operates a cosmetics shop, a business she has been running for the last 10 years and which earns her a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy stock of hair products and other beauty products. Her profits will be used to educate her children. Her dream is to enlarge her business.

loans.use: To buy hair chemicals and other beauty products.

loans.name: Maria Imakulata

texts.en:
Maria is a single 19-year-old woman who owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has 1 year of experience in this business. Maria needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome to help her crops grow.  She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 350 talas per week) to continue to improve her growing operation.

In 2012, Maria joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Maria's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed killers to help her grow vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Juliana is 49 years old.  She is married to Jonathan, and the couple are blessed with three children aged 25, 13 and 9 years respectively. She owns a grocery store, a business she started five years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 7,000. 

She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase products requested by her customers, such as fruit, vegetables and maize. The profit she earns from the loan will help her to start dairy farming. Her hope is to improve her standard of living. This is her fifth loan.

loans.use: To purchase fruit, vegetables, and maize for sale.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en: Serah is 37 years old. She runs a grocery store to earn a living. She has been in the business for 3 years and has employed one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to expand it further in the future. She has applied for 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy 3 sacks of maize, beans and rice for sale.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of maize, beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Foisaga

texts.en:
Foisaga is a 35-year-old woman who is married with two children, ages 2 and 5. She owns & operates a general store, where she sells a variety of goods in the local community.  She has 1 year of experience with this business.  Foisaga needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase additional products to increase her inventory.  She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 500 talas per week) to continue to expand the store.

In 2012, Foisaga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Foisaga's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to build up the inventory in her general store

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 52 years old, and is married to Kariuki.  She has been a mixed crop farmer for the last ten years, and earns a monthly income of KES 9,000, which she uses to support her family.

Nancy is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to the organization by an existing KADET customer.  She will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. The anticipated profits will be used to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to venture in to pig rearing, which will help her improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en: Oyuntsetseg is 48 years old and lives with her three kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt/ nomadic tent) in Western Mongolia. Her older kid is employed and the younger two are college students. She operates a meat trading business. She started her business in 1995 with her late husband. Since her husband died, she has been handling the business on her own. Over the years she gained many regular customers and trusted suppliers. Now that the Mongolian holiday season is approaching, she needs additional supplies in order to meet the demand. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "Now that my two kids are in college, I need to work even harder". She is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy more meat.

loans.use: To buy more meat

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 62 years old, married, and has 2 children. He sells sweaters, blouses and skirts to earn a living.  He has been in the business for 10 years and describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business.  He hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 100,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy more sweaters, blouses and skirts to sell.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, blouses and skirts to sell

loans.name: Ath

texts.en:
Ath is a 47-year-old married woman who has been residing in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She has been blessed with 6 children: 3 are married and 3 are single. Ath presently works as a local farmer. She cultivates her rice crops with a plentiful of harvest in both rainy season and dry season every year because there is a main source of water from the nearby river. 

She is now asking for some funds from HKL and Kiva to buy cashew nuts in bulk from a local plantation to stock for future sale. She hopes that she will be able to make a good profit from her investment. For her prospect, she wants to expand her business and ensure a comfortable living for her children.

loans.use: to buy cashew nuts in bulk from a local plantation to stock for future sale.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea is a 43-year-old married woman who generates her livelihood from an agricultural business. She has become a single mother of five children, two of whom have already started their own families and live separately around Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham. To help the family out of poverty, one of her sons has been operating a materials recycling business among the whole commune. He goes through the village to collect and purchase the materials from local people and then he sells them to the recycling industry for profit.

Chea wants to borrow a loan of $1,200 to keep as sufficient capital to invest in the materials-recycling business. With the helpful funds, her son will be able to purchase as many materials as he can and thereby increase their daily income. In the future, Chea wants to become the owner of a medium-size recycling industry in her neighborhood.

loans.use: to have capital for the purchase of recycled materials.

loans.name: Israel

texts.es: Israel de 48 años de edad, está casado con Rebeca de 46 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 7 hijos. Juntos viven en la comunidad de Periavente alta del distrito de Llochegua. Él es agricultor dedicado al cultivo de cacao y café que junto a su querida esposa trabajan duro para obtener una buena producción. Sus puntos de venta los realiza en el distrito de Llochegua a los grandes acopiadores quienes le pagan un buen precio por sus productos. Asimismo nos comenta que anteriormente se dedicaba a la albañilería, y con las ganancias que percibian logró comprar su terreno agrícola donde ahora cultiva café y cacao, por tal motivo es que está contento. Israel en un futuro esta pensando abrir un restaurante en el distrito de Llochegua con la finalidad de tener mejores ingresos y a la vez sus hijos menores puedan estudiar en un mejor colegio. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que él una vez mas se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Está contento con su banco comunal por que son alegres y trabajadores. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles realizará el mantenimiento de sus parcelas de cacao y café, para ello contratará peones.
texts.en:
Israel, 48, is married to Rebeca, 46.  They have seven children from this relationship.  Together they live in the community of Periavente Alta in the district of Llochegua.  He is a farmer who grows cacao and coffee with his beloved wife.  They work hard to get a good production.

He makes his sales in the district of Llochegua to the big buyers who pay him a good price for his products.  He also tells us that before he used to work in bricklaying, and with the profits he made he managed to buy his plot of farmland where now he grows coffee and cacao.  This is why he is happy.

Israel is planning to open a restaurant in the future, in the district of Llochegua, with the goal of having better income and, at the same time, for his younger children to be able to study in a better school.

This will be his second loan with MFP, for which he once again promises to make his payments punctually.  He is happy with his communal bank because they are happy and hardworking.

With the 3,000 PEN he will do the maintenance on his cacao and coffee plots, for which he will hire farmworkers.

loans.use: to hire farmworkers.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en: Amanda is a 44-year-old single woman who has two children, ages 6 and 16. She describes herself as a patient and hardworking woman who began planting and harvesting grenadinas (an orange, seeded fruit with a pulpy interior) about six years ago in order to make a living for herself and her kids. Although it is very hard work, Amanda is happy to do this job, for it is how she is able to pay for her children's education. With this loan she hopes to build a greenhouse so that her grenadinas can last through the rainy season. Her dream for the future is to see her kids graduate college and to see that her hard work paid off.

loans.use: To build a greenhouse for her grenadinas (an orange, seeded fruit with a pulpy interior).

loans.name: Missebo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MISSEBO est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontines. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Joséphine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Joséphine est âgée de 36 ans et vit au Bénin. Joséphine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Joséphine est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Jean. Le couple a six enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Joséphine vend depuis une vingtaine d’année de l’huile de palme qu'elle produit et des vins de palme dans une région du Bénin. Parallèlement à cette activité, Joséphine vend divers articles (plastiques, gasoil). Joséphine s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Joséphine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MISSEBO, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Missebo group is composed of three people living in the same neighborhood and belonging to the same community savings group. The group’s representative, by the name of Josephine, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Josephine is 36 years old and lives in Benin. Josephine did not go to school. She is married to Jean, a farmer. They have six dependent children, all in school. In addition to their own children, the spouses have one other child in their care.  In order to provide for various family needs, for some 20 years Josephine has been selling palm oil and palm wine in one of the region of Benin. In addition to this, Josephine also sells miscellaneous items (plastic articles,  fuel oil). Josephine stocks up in a town of Benin. With the goal of meeting customer demand and increasing her sales volume and her profits, Josephine, together with the other members of her group, is seeking her third loan from ALIDé. The two prior loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy palm nuts and miscellaneous items for resale (plastic articles,  fuel oil)

loans.name: Taumaloto

texts.en:
Taumaloto is 52 years old and married with seven children. She runs a small lawn-mowing business in which she cuts grass for people in her community.  She has one year of experience with this business.  

Taumaloto needs a loan of 1,000 talas to purchase supplies to keep mowing lawns. She plans to use her profits (estimated to be 400 talas per week) to continuing improving her new business.

In 2012, Taumaloto joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Taumaloto's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her lawn-mowing business.

loans.name: Chab

texts.en:
Chab, age 30, is in two businesses at the same time. She is a local rice farmer and is a fresh-fish vendor from a local market in Baray district. Her husband is very supportive to help her in each business. This couple has tried hard because they want to ensure a better living and provide a further education to their two school-age children.

Chab would like to acquire these funds to pay for the process of cultivating dry-season rice. She hopes to produce a good harvest through using the loan from HKL and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for the process of cultivating dry-season rice.

loans.name: Hieu

texts.en:
Hieu  was born in 1964 and has three children;  one of them is studying at university. Being a farmer, she grows rice and raises pigs and chickens. Her business started many years ago. When she has free time, she goes to work at a brick factory to earn extra daily income.  

Joining our credit program in 2004, she used loans to expand her farming activity. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 8,502,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) to rebuild her family's toilet system.

loans.use: to rebuild her family's toilet system.

loans.name: Koy

texts.en:
Koy is 38 years old and a mother of five schoolchildren. She permanently lives with her own family in the Baray district of Kompong Tom. She has been engaged in agriculture for her livelihood. Her common business activities are rice cultivating and pig fattening. From each business, she is able to earn around $2.50 per day. She really enjoys doing these businesses because she has her husband, who always supports her work, either indoors or outdoors.

At the present, she would like to apply for a loan to add to her capital to buy pigs and feed and to build a good pigpen. This loan will enable her to develop her business and increase her household income. Her future goal is to have a big farm for raising pigs, both for meat and offspring.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed and to build a good pigpen.

loans.name: Julia Monserrate

texts.es:
En el cantón Olmedo de la Provincia de Manabí cada quince días  se reúne el Banco Comunal Esfuerzo y Poder, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Julia, tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 5 hijas mayores de edad, una de ellas aun vive con ella. Su marido es comerciante.

Ella junto a su esposo se dedican al comercio, venden ropa de todo tipo, todos los días instalan un pequeño local en una de las vías del cantón donde les permiten a los comerciantes vender sus productos, trabajan todos los días y los días que más venden son los fines de semana ya que son los días de feria y es cuando llegan hasta la ciudad las personas del campo a abastecerse de productos. Compran su mercadería en  Guayaquil o la compra en su local cuando llegan comerciantes a entregar al por mayor, llevan más de tres años en este negocio el cual es la fuente de su sustento diario.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo y así surtir aun más su negocio. Lleva más de cinco ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho. 

Su sueño es tener buena salud para continuar adelante.
texts.en:
The village bank Esfuerzo y Poder meets every 15 days in the canton of Olmedo in the province of Manabi. This is a place known for beautiful countryside and for people who work hard farming and raising animals.

Here we meet Julia, 58, who is married and has 5 grown children. One of them still lives with her. Her husband is a merchant.

She works together with her husband in commerce, selling all types of clothes. Every day they set up in a small stall on one of the roads in the canton where merchants are allowed to hawk their products. They work every day and their sales are highest on the weekend because those are market days and that's when people from the countryside come to the city to stock up on products. They buy their merchandise in Guayaquil or in their town when wholesale merchants come through. They've been working in this business for more than 3 years and it's their main source of income.

This loan will be used to buy all types of clothing so she can stock their store. She's been with the village bank for 5 cycles and like it because the loans have helped her a lot. 

Her dream is to have good health so she can continue to make progress.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Mahuclo1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUCLO1 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et appartiennent à un groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Juliette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Juliette est âgée de 45 ans et vit au Bénin. Juliette a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Juliette est mariée à un certain Félix. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Juliette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Juliette vend depuis sept ans, des chaussures et des vêtements à son domicile et de façon ambulante. Juliette s’approvisionne dans sa région et dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Juliette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUCLO1, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les quatre crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The MAHUCLO1 group is made up of three women who are friends and belong to a "tontine" (savings group).  The facilitator of the group, named Juliette, is raising her hand in the photo.  She is 45 years old and lives in Benin.  She left school at the elementary level and is married to a man named Felix.  The couple has four children who all attend school and whom they financially support.  Juliette lives with her husband and children.  Juliette and Felix jointly take care of the various household expenses.  In order to cover the various family expenses, Juliette has been selling shoes and clothes for 7 years, from her home and also door-to-door.  She gets her merchandise in her own region and also in a city in Benin.  In order to meet her customers' needs, and to increase her turnover and income, she and the other members of the MAHUCLO1 group are requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé.  The previous four loans were well repaid.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es: Carmen  vive en la ciudad de Cartagena y es beneficiaria del proyecto de vivienda sostenible, liderado en esa ciudad por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Su hogar está conformado por su cónyuge y sus 7 hijos en las edades de 7 a 28 años, con los que sueña ver convertidos en personas exitosas. Ella llegó a Ciudad Bicentenario como damnificada de la ola invernal y dice que “desde que llegó este  macroproyecto de vivienda mi  vida cambió”, porque no solo tiene vivienda, si no que su negocio, una chaza donde vende mercancía variada como ella dice  “ha pegado” y siente la necesidad de hacerlo crecer. Esto es porque tiene más clientes, es reconocida y cada día que pasa, requiere tener más cantidad de dinero, para invertir y responderle a su clientela. Su gran desafío es lograr con su poco capital resolver los pedidos de su clientela,  esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará ropa de cama, ropa femenina e informal, útiles escolares y frutas de la temporada. Con su inversión logrará aumentar su capital, rotar rápidamente su dinero y aumentar la fidelidad de los clientes, que reconocerán que Carmen está siempre buscando respuesta a sus necesidades y para ella es una oportunidad de generar ingresos,  sirviendo siempre con excelencia a su clientela.
texts.en:
Carmen lives in the city of Cartagena and is a beneficiary of the sustainable living project, which in this city is headed up by the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. Her family is made up of her husband and their seven children between the ages of 7 and 28, who she dreams will become successful. She arrived in the Bicentennial City as a result of being made homeless by winter flooding and says that "since I arrived this macro housing project has changed my life" because she not only has housing but also a business, a stall where she sells various merchandise. As she says, "it stuck" and she feels the need to make it grow. This is because she has more customers and is recognized, and with each passing day she needs more money to invest and respond to her customers. 

Her biggest challenge is to fill her customers' orders with the small amount of capital that she has. For that reason she came to Kiva for her first loan, through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will use it to buy bed sheets, women's casual clothing, school supplies and seasonal fruits. With this investment she will increase her capital, turn over her money quickly and increase her customers' loyalty, because they will recognize that Carmen is always looking to meet their needs. It's an opportunity for her to generate income by serving her customers with excellence.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets, women's casual clothing, school supplies and seasonal fruits.

loans.name: Von

texts.en:
Von is a diligent mother who tries hard for her family. She is 51, married and has six children. Her priority in life is to generate a good income to ensure a good living standard for her family. She wants her children to live in a comfortable way with enough basic necessities, especially education. Presently, she raises a few head of breeding pigs in her yard for offspring, besides the rice farming. 

With the requested amount, she will purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to produce a good harvest in the coming season. She hopes that the funds will be granted to her to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Mout

texts.en:
Mout, 24, has been involved in a used-clothes selling business to help her husband in earning income. She sells from a local market of Ornlong Veng district, Siem Reap province. She has been in this business since 2005 and she is able to earn an average of $5.00 per day. She has been blessed with a lovely young kid.

This time she is requesting a loan to purchase stock of used clothes for a constant sale as these days her business has run out of its stock. She tells us that these funds are very useful for her family. At this time, she is in need to sustain her present business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of used clothes for a constant sale.

loans.name: Purevjav

texts.en:
Purevjav is a 31-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two children in Bayan-Ulgii province in Western Mongolia. Her husband is an entrepreneur who makes traditional house parts; her oldest daughter studies at the secondary school; and her youngest is in kindergarden. 

She started retailing sacks of wood and coal in 2007. Most people in Mongolia use stoves to stay warm and to cook. Therefore, this kind of business is always needed, and the demand always exists. She would like to get the wood in large quantities for the stoves and for the traditional house parts and equipment. During the past five years, she became experienced in the field. 

Purevjav is a bright lady who says that, "I would like to expand my business by getting the supplies in large quantities so that I could increase the income and save for my kids." The total amount she is requesting is 800,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) for the wood.

loans.use: To purchase wood.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen was born in 1976. She has two children who are in high school. Being a farmer, she focuses on growing rice and vegetables for sale. She started her work five years ago. In 2004, she accessed her first loan to invest in her farming. Since then, she grows more vegetables and also buys from other areas  to sell. For her new loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 9,810,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) to buy more fertilizer and more fresh vegetables to meet the demand of customers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and more fresh vegetables to meet the demand of customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to advertise and to hire a couple of extra people

loans.name: Sandagsuren

texts.en: Sandagsuren is a 54-year-old man who lives with his wife in Hovd province in Western Mongolia. His wife is a retiree and his children live separately. He has been doing a plumbing and welding business since 1981. He runs the business all the time and so far, he is working on construction plumbing. He is planning to expand the business by getting plumbing materials in large quantities. Sandagsuren is a bright man who says, "I would like to expand my business so that I could earn more and save it for the children marriage". The total amount he is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT for the plumbing equipment.

loans.use: To purchase plumbing equipment

loans.name: Hien

texts.en: Hien is 31 years old with one son who is attending elementary school.  Her main activity is making rice noodles to sell. Her business started 6 years ago and creates a stable income for her family. Being our client in 2004, she used loans to expand her business. Currently, she requires a loan of 9,810,000 VND to buy rice to make rice noodles.

loans.use: to buy rice to make noodles to sell

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
This is Analyn, 33, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to George and the mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Analyn maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8, 000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy merchandise items and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Analyn fervently hopes that her child will be able to graduate one day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en: Riza is a 44-year-old woman who lives with her husband and three kids in Bayan-Ulgii province in Western Mongolia. She started her sewing business in 2003 by making products at home. Since 2010, she has been renting a room in the Red Cross organization building with two women. Besides making work wear, she also makes traditional clothes and 'ger', traditional house's inside and outside covers. To make the sewing process faster, she needs to buy sewing machines and other necessary equipment. Riza is a diligent woman who says, "I would like to expand my business by making the process faster and receiving many orders. Therefore I need to buy these equipment with the sufficient support so that the business would be profitable and I could save for my 3 kids future". The total amount she is requesting is 2,000,000 MNT for the sewing equipment.

loans.use: To purchase sewing equipment

loans.name: Ky

texts.en: Ky is 60 years old with two grown children. Being a farmer, she grows rice and raises chickens. Her business started many years ago.  Joining in our credit program in 2003, she used loans to expand her business. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 8,502,000 VND to improve the housing for her chickens and buy food for them.

loans.use: to improve the chicken house and buy food for them

loans.name: Jhony Gilmer

texts.es:
Jhony es un joven trabajador de 35 años de edad, padre de familia de 2 hijos, actualmente tienen su casa ubicada en un caserío rural de nombre “El Porvenir” es un caserío pequeño donde sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y ganadera exclusivamente, pertenece al distrito de Olmos  el cual se esta ubicado a 1 hora de la Ciudad de Chiclayo, por ser un caserío el cual esta en vía de desarrollo por ahora solo cuentan con el servicio de luz eléctrica.

Jhony se dedica al servicio de transporte de pasajeros de caserío en caserío, con sus ahorros que ah logrado obtener trabajando en el campo como agricultor  compró una Mototaxy en la que trabaja de lunes a sábado desde muy temprano hasta altas horas de la tarde. Su paradero esta ubicado en el distrito de Olmos cubriendo la ruta Olmos-Povernir-Ñaupe. 
Actividad a la que ya se viene dedicando 4años seguidos y con lo que ha podido mantener a su esposa y sus 2 hijos los cuales están en edad escolar.

Jhony es conciente de que la zona donde trabaja, sus carreteras están muy deterioradas para el tipo de vehiculo que tiene por lo que el mantenimiento y cambio de llantas tienen que ser continuos para mantener en buen estado su vehiculo y así pueda seguir trabajando con normalidad. Por lo que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles  los que los invertirá en mantenimiento y compra de llantas.

Jhony siempre ha sido considerado un hombre trabajador y muy responsable pues no solo lo saben sus familiares si que también cuenta con buenas referencias de sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Jhony, aged 35, is a hard-working young man and the family father of two children. The family lives in El Porvenir, a rural hamlet whose residents work exclusively in farming and cattle breeding. The hamlet belongs to the district of Olmos, one hour from the city of Chiclayo. It is located in a developing area and electricity is the sole public utility to which it is connected so far.

Jhony's activity consists in transporting passengers between the villages of the area. With the savings from his job as an agricultural laborer he bought a vehicle, which he runs from Monday to Saturday from early morning to late evening. His point of departure is in the district of Olmos, where he covers the route Olmos-Porvenir-Ñaupe. He has done this activity for the past four years and could thus support his wife and their two school-aged children.

Jhony is well aware that the roads in his area are badly damaged and have taken their toll on his vehicle. He must continuously have his car serviced and buy new tires to keep it in good condition and be able to work normally. Therefore he came to the microfinance institution Edpyme Alternativa and applied for a loan of 2000 new soles which he will use to service his vehicle and buy new tires.

Jhony has always been considered a hard worker with a high sense of responsibility. This is not only known by his relatives, but also by his neighbors who credit him with good references.

loans.use: to have his vehicle serviced and buy new tires.

loans.name: Dayana Jhanina

texts.es: Jhanina es una joven soltera de 23 años de edad que trabaja y vive en la cuidad de Cochabamba, dentro el departamento de Cochabamba, ella trabaja en Oficina de servicios juridicos como secretaria, su sueldo es muy poco y tiene 6 hermanos menores, vive solo con su madre, no existe una figura paternal en su familia, por tanto ella junto a su madre compraron un "taxi" para hacerlo trabajar en una linea de Radiomovil con chofer, y asi tener ingreos para mantener y alimentar a sus hermanos menores. Pero lamentablemente el taxi se arruinó y necesita ahora reparación para poder seguir trabajando. Es esa la razon por la cual Jhanina requeire un préstamo de KIVA para hacer arreglar su auto. Ella esta muy agradecida que haya instituciones en le mundo que puedan ofrecer este apoyo a la gente que no tiene recursos economicos pero que quiere surgir en la vida.
texts.en:
Jhanina is a 23 year old, single, young woman who works and lives in the city of Cochabamba, in the region of Cochabamba, She works in a legal services office as a secretary. Her wage is very low and she has six younger siblings, she lives alone with her mother and there is no father figure in her family. 

However, together with her mother, she has bought a "taxi" and a driver to work on a Radiomovil line, so they can make an income to support and feed her younger siblings.

Sadly, the taxi has broken down and now needs repairs in order to continue working. This is why Jhanina requires a KIVA loan in order to repair her car.

She is very grateful that there are organisations in the world that can offer this support to people who don't have economic resources, but want to succeed in life.

loans.use: to repair the tool that allows her to work (her taxi).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two bags of pea seeds and four bags of fertiliser

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
This is Teresa, fifty, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Renato, her business partner, and the father of her three children. She and her husband, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Teresa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP-5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 22,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Teresa hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Tilekbai

texts.en:
Tilekbai is forty-five years old and lives with his wife and four kids in a Ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayan-Ulgii province in western Mongolia. His wife used to be a waitress, but now she is unemployed. His eldest kid is a college student and the three younger ones are school students. 

He started his livestock and meat wholesaling business in 2005. He travels through rural areas and collects the livestock. Over the years, he has gained many regular customers and trusted suppliers. Now that the Mongolian holiday season is approaching, his demand is increasing. He needs to increase his supplies in order to meet demand. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says "Now that my kids are growing, I need to work as hard as I can". 

He is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to buy four camels.

loans.use: To purchase four camels.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha de 36 años, convive con Vidal con quien tiene 5 hijos de 21, 18, 15, 12 y 8 años. Ella y su familia viven en una casa propia en el anexo de Huaripampa, en el distrito de Palca, provincia de Tarma.
Desde los 15 años empezó a dedicarse a la agricultura, ayudando a sus padres en la mantención de su hogar. Con la misma y fuerza y convicción hace lo mismo, pero ahora para sostener a sus hijos.
Su rutina es cansada, atender a sus hijos, a su hogar y luego dirigirse a sus chacras para cultivar sus productos. Ella no vacila en sus labores por que es consciente que, con esfuerzo logrará sus objetivos. Se dedica al cultivo de papas, arvejas y habas, cuyos productos los comercializa en la ciudad de Tarma.
“Llevo más de 20 años vendiendo mis productos, algunas veces voy hasta Lima, ahí los precios son mejores”, menciona. Vidal y sus 2 hijos mayores la ayudan en las cansadas faenas, así siente el apoyo de su familia, que es su principal motivo para trabajar. Éste sería su préstamo número 13 que obtendría de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. “La Libertad de Huaripampa”, es el nombre de su banco comunal del que se siente contenta por el trabajo en equipo.
Con el dinero del crédito podrá comprar 2 bolsas de semillas de arvejas para iniciar una siembra en el mes de febrero.
texts.en:
Bertha, 36 years old, lives together with Vidal, with whom she has 5 children aged 21, 18, 15, 12 and 8. She and her family live in their own home in the small town of Huaripampa, in the Palca district, Tarma province.

15 years ago, she began working in agriculture, helping her parents to maintain their home. She still works in the same line of work with the same effort and dedication, but now it is to support her children.

Her routine is tiring, looking after her children and her home and then heading to their fields to cultivate her products. She doesn't waver in her efforts because she knows that with effort she will achieve her objectives. She grows potatos, peas and beans and sells the produce in the city of Tarma.

"I've been selling my produce for more than 20 years, sometimes I travel as far as Lima as the prices are better there", she comments. Vidal and their two eldest children help with the tiring tasks, so she feels supported by her family, who are her main motivation. 

This will be the 13th loan that she gets from MFP, and she commits to being punctual with her payment schedule. Her communal bank is called "La Libertad de Huaripampa" and she is happy to work in this team.

With the loan, she will be able to buy 2 bags of pea seeds to begin sowing in February.

loans.use: to buy two bags of pea seeds.

loans.name: Le

texts.en:
Le is fifty-two years old with two grown children. She runs a wood workshop that makes family furniture. Her business started two years ago. 

She was a client of our credit program in 2003, and finds it fits with her business.  In this new loan cycle, she is asking for a loan of 8,502,000 VND to buy wood.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
This is Ligaya, sixty-one, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother of four children. She manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ligaya runs an “ukay-ukay” business. “Ukay” literally means to “dig out” or “hollow out” from a stack or heap of anything. In Yolanda’s case, she sells used (but not yet worn out) clothes that are usually stacked up on a table or mat. Some special kinds are displayed on hangers. In the Philippines, especially in urban poor communities, many people resort to buying used clothes from “ukay-ukay” stalls. These are very much cheaper than brand new clothes sold in malls. Since her stall is located in an urban poor public market, her business flourishes. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) net sales every day. 

To help her expand the business, Yolanda is requesting a PHP 26,000 loan to buy additional used-but-quality clothes. Customers are attracted to buy from an “ukay-ukay” stall with lots of clothes to choose from. She plans to add more pants or jeans, also used bags and footwear. If she can roll over the profits from this loan, she can meet the customers’ demand. Through proper management of capital and profit, she can expand her business and boost its income.

Ligaya hopes to to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and were she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory of clothes and processed meats.

loans.name: Saveng

texts.en: Saveng, fifty-three, is married, and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is a motor mechanic who earns approximately USD 3 per day. Four of her children are employed at the shoe factory. In order to improve her family livelihood, Saveng is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to run a new business by purchasing a pumping machine to sell to generate extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to rent a store in the market to sell pumping machines. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house and support her children to study until they get Bachelors degree.

loans.use: to purchase a pumping machine to sell.

loans.name: Umitbek

texts.en:
Umitbek is a 42 year old man who lives with his wife and 4 kids in Bayan-Ulgii province in Western Mongolia. His wife is unemployed. The oldest daughter studies at the college, 2 kids are at the secondary school and the youngest one is in kindergarden. 

He has been running a taxi service with his motorcycle. The daily income from the business is the only economic source for the family members. But the motorcycle has broken and he needs to fix it to keep the business normal and earn income. 

Umitbek is a hardworking guy who says that "I would like to continue my business further so that I could earn for the family to keep the livelihood. I am the only person responsible for the family". The total amount he is requesting is 700,000 MNT to buy tires for his motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy tires

loans.name: Liv

texts.en:
Liv has been married for many years and has started an independent living since then. She is 35 years old now and is operating a retail business from her house located in Kompong Cham province. She sells many types of merchandise like sweet things, biscuits, canned foods, groceries, soft drinks and other household things for home use. For this business, she is able to generate an income of $5.00 per day. 

Presently Liv’s family is experiencing difficulties due to the lack of water for household use. To solve the problem, Liv is taking out a loan from HKL to dig a well in her yard and buy a pumping machine. Liv hopes that she will be able to provide her children with a good standard of living in the coming years through her efforts.

loans.use: to dig a well in her yard and buy a pumping machine.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
This is Mary Jane, 39, resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Zosimo, a messenger, and mother to 4 children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Mary Jane runs a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. The dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing in as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy merchandise and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Mary Jane fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise and products needed for her business.

loans.name: Adiyannamjil

texts.en:
Adiyannamjil is twenty-four years old and lives with his wife and a daughter in Western Mongolia. His wife is unemployed and his daughter stays at home with her mother. 

Adiyannamjil runs a taxi service. He drives his own car to take passengers to their destination. But due to the unpaved road in Mongolia, his car is broken. It needs to be fixed because his business is the family's only source of income. He is a good-natured guy who says that "I would like to continue my business successfully and am hoping for expansion. I am the only person responsible for my family's livelihood and its income". 

The total amount he is requesting is 1,800,000 MNT to replace his car's motor.

loans.use: To buy new a motor for his taxi-car.

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Sang is thirty-nine years old with two children. Both of them are in high-school. Her main activity is making paper artifacts used at funerals – a traditional business in Vietnam. She has run this business for 10 years now and gets a good income. 

Joining our credit program in 2003, she used her loans to buy paper and bamboo materials. For this new loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 9,810,000 VND to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy paper and bamboo materials.

loans.name: Chuyen

texts.en:
Chuyen is fifty-two years old and has two children who work as carpenters. She is a farmer. She grows rice and raises chickens and ducks. Her business started many years ago.

She joined our credit program in 2003, and used her loans to expand her chicken and duck-raising business. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 9,810,000 VND to buy food for her poultry.

loans.use: to buy food for her poultry.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong, thirty-nine, is widowed and resides with six children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling sugarcane juice for over three years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Two of her children are employed at a garment factory and earn approximately USD 4 per day. 

In order to improve her family livelihood, Hong is requesting a loan of USD 500 to have the capital to purchase more sugarcane to squeeze in order to produce juice to sell. In the future, she would like to build a new house and support her children to study until they get Bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more sugarcane to squeeze in order to produce juice to sell.

loans.name: Nyamdorj

texts.en: Nyamdorj is 58 years old and lives with his wife in Western Mongolia. His wife is a cleaner at the big market. His children live independently. He has been retailing sacks of coals and livestock. The business is going really well and he plans to expand the business by buying the livestock supplies in large quantities. This kind of business always succeeds in Mongolia as most people use stoves to stay warm and cook besides using meats in their daily lives. Nyamdorj is a diligent man who says that "I want to expand my business by buying the supplies in large amounts so that I can save for my family". The total amount he is requesting is 1,500,000 MNT for the livestock.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock

loans.name: Khuyen

texts.en: Khuyen, a widower, is 49 years old with 1 son. Being a farmer, she grows rice and raises chickens. Her business started many years ago. Joining the credit program in 2003, she used loans to expand her farm. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 8,502,000 VND to buy food for the chickens.

loans.use: to buy food for her chickens

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
This is Mary Ann, thirty, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Mondaring, a side car driver, and is the mother of two children. By the grace of God, Rosario has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Mary Ann operates a food stall. In their community she sells snacks like burgers and other street food staples and also cooked viands. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue running her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more raw products and supplies she uses in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Mary Ann dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients and products she needs in her business.

loans.name: Otgonsuren

texts.en:
Otgonsuren is thirty-eight years old and lives with her husband and two children in Hovd province, Western Mongolia. Her husband is unemployed and her son studies at high school. She has been running a meat and livestock retailing business since 2006. During this time, she has not stopped working or contributing to the family's income. Income from the business has become the only source of finance for the family members. 

Due to the approach of the lunar calendar new year festival, she is planning to get supplies in large quantities and sell them. She is such a bright woman, and she says "I would like to expand my business and improve my family income and livelihood so that I can enroll my son in college". 

The total amount she is requesting for the supplies is 2,500,000 MNT.

loans.use: To purchase meat at wholesale price.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
This is Gina, thirty-eight, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Nandy, a driver, and is the mother of four children. She and her husband, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Gina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Gina hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jagdalmaa

texts.en:
Jagdalmaa is fifty-one years old and lives with her husband in Hovd province in Western Mongolia. Her husband works as a fireman in wintertime. Her daughter studies at the college in the capital city. She has been running a sewing business since 2002. During these ten years, she has developed regular customers and makes different sorts of clothes. 

Her business is going really well and the service is appreciated by the customers. She is a motivated woman who says that "I would like to expand my business by getting sewing materials in large quantities so that I can improve my business and increase my family's income to pay my daughter's college tuition fees". 

The total amount she is requesting is 2,000,000 MNT for the supplies.

loans.use: To purchase sewing materials.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
This is Marivic, thirty-nine, a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Rodel, a sales clerk, and is the mother of two children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and support her children’s schooling. 

Marivic operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Marivic hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of giving her family a good future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: March

texts.en:
March, forty-two, is married, resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in agricultural business for over twenty years, have extensive experience, and are successful in their career. They are involved in growing rice and fattening up pigs to sell. Additionally, her husband runs a motor-taxi when he is free from his farming work. One of her children is a garment worker. 

Due to the fact that the present motorbike is too old, March is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run his transportation service. By doing so, her husband will have a new motorbike which will attract more customers and generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business and support her children to study until they get Bachelor degrees. Moreover, she plans to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run his transportation service.

loans.name: Bazar

texts.en:
Bazar is fifty-four years old and lives with his wife and three kids in Hovd province in Western Mongolia. Two of his kids are in college and the youngest kid studies at the secondary school. His wife helps with the business. 

Bazar has been running a business retailing sacks of coal and wood for 14 years. Due to the long winter in Mongolia, this kind of business is successful between November and March. Therefore, he saves the income that he gains during these months. Now he plans to get the supplies in large quantities so he can purchase them at good prices and attract more customers. Bazar is a diligent guy who says that "I would like to expand my business activity by getting the supplies in large quantities so that I can run the business successfully and save for the college fees for my two kids". 

The total amount he is requesting is 1,500,000 MNT for the supplies.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
This is Gina, forty-four, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. Her husband is Bernardo, a tricycle driver, and she is the mother of six children. Together with her husband and children, she manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Gina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also sells cooked viands in her store. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Gina hopes her business will grow in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is from Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is forty-five years of age and married. She has three children of school-age. She is in the retail business, operating a sari-sari store or general store to earn a living. She has been running her business for over four years and as she operates her business proficiently, the primary return generated from her business is very excellent. 

Merlyn made a choice to join GDMPC to have easy access to financial services. She applied for a loan to the amount of PHP 10,000 in order to purchase grocery goods to sell in her general store. She is now on her seventh loan cycle. Merlyn hopes to make her business bigger and to triple the return of earnings in the future.

loans.use: to purchase supplementary grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
This is Corazon, fifty-six, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a single parent and a mother of six children. Together with her children, she manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and her children’s studies.
