Corazon operates a market stall. She sells fish and vegetable products in the community market. She buys a quantity of fish and vegetables and sells it per kilo. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of fish and vegetables to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Corazon dreams of being able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of fish and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Battsooj

texts.en:
Battsooj is a forty-year-old man who lives with his wife and three kids in Hovd province in Western Mongolia. His wife is unemployed, and takes care of the youngest kid. His two other kids study at the secondary school. He has been running a meat and livestock retailing business since 2003. The products he purchases are appreciated by the local customers. 

Due to the approach of the lunar calendar new year, he is planning to expand the business by getting supplies in large quantities. Battsooj is a bright man who says that "I would like to expand my business and earn more to improve my family's livelihood. Because the business income is the only source of finance in my family. I also have further plans to improve the business". 

The total amount he is requesting is 3,000,000 MNT for the supplies.

loans.use: To purchase meat.

loans.name: Marley Martha

texts.es: La señora Marley tiene 51 años de edad, vive en la cuidad de Cochabamba, en el departamento de Cochabamba, es una persona muy trabajadora, no estudió en la universidad por la necesidad trabajar, ella actualmente trabaja con la venta de pollo crudo por las mañanas y preparacion y venta de pollo frito por las noches en su barrio, ella vive en una casa en alquiler donde cuenta con un salon amplio para poder vender comida, pero este salón no esta condiciones para funcionar, es cual el motivo por lo que Marley solicita un prestamo a KIVA para poder hacer arreglar la fachada, y ademas comprar proveerse de arroz, papa, insumos, mesas y sillas, para poder agrandar su negocio y poder asi vender mas platos de comida por la noche. Ella esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que tiene de acceder a un prestamo KIVA mediante en la institucion financiera CIDRE.
texts.en: Marley is 51 years old and lives in the city of Cochabamba, in Cochabamba department.  She is a very hard-working woman who didn't study at university because she had to work. She currently works selling raw chicken in the mornings.  In the evenings she makes and sells fried chicken in her neighborhood.  She lives in a rental house which has a large room where she can sell food.  However, this room is in bad condition and so Marley is requesting a Kiva loan to do up the exterior and also stock up with rice, potatoes, supplies, tables and chairs so that she can grow her business and thereby sell more plates of food in the evenings.  She is very grateful for the opportunity that she has to access a Kiva loan through CIDRE's financial institution.

loans.use: to have working capital for her food sales business

loans.name: Lo

texts.en:
Lo is thirty-four years old with two children who are at secondary school. She is a farmer and grows rice. When she has free time from farming, she works in another job as a builder to get more money for her family's needs and to pay for medicine for her husband who is ill. 

She joined our credit program in 2005, and used loans to expand her farming activity. In this new loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,502,000 VND to pay for her husband's medicine.

loans.use: to pay for medicine for her husband.

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
This is Nerissa, forty-two, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Emmanuel, a driver, and is the mother of three children. Together with her husband and children, she manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Nerissa oversees operations of their vehicle rental business. They have two L300 vans that they rent out to transport cargo or for people who need vehicles when transferring household goods to other places. They provide their services within the city and nearby provinces. Aside from this she also earns other income from making rugs. She earns a minimum of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy spare parts and do maintenance on her vans. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Nerissa hopes to have her own house someday and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their vehicles.

loans.name: Ochir

texts.en:
Ochir is a fifty-three-year-old woman who lives with her husband in Hovd province in Western Mongolia. Her husband is retired and her daughter studies at the college in the capital city. She has been running a food retailing business since 2009. But she has more than ten years experience of running a business. 

Due to the approach of the biggest festival, she would like to expand the business by getting her supplies in large quantities. Ochir is a good-natured and diligent woman who says that "I would like to expand the business by getting candies in large quantities and in different sorts so that I can improve our livelihood and pay for my daughter's college fees". 

The total amount she is requesting is 1,500,000 MNT to purchase candy from Bayan-Ulgii province.

loans.use: To purchase candy from Bayan-Ulgii province.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: El señor Edwin tiene 31 años, es una persona muy trabajadora, es soltero, vive en villa Israel un barrio muy pobre ubicado en los suburbios de la cuidad, en el departamento de Cochabamba, en esta localidad es que el tiene su casita, y su pequeña panaderia, con su  horno donde elabora el pan desde muy tempranas horas del dia para entregar antes de las 9 de la mañana a las tiendas y colegios, el margen de ganancia que el genera es muy pequeño debido a la poca produccion que tiene. Ademas que no podria competir con las panaderias grandes que vienen a dejar su pan en vehiculos distribuidores a las mismas tiendas donde el reparte. por tanto edwin, el cliente requiere de un prestamo que le permita comprar mas insumos, abastecerse de harina, manteca, sal, aceite, levadura y azucar y asi con esto doblar o triplicar su producción para la venta en su zona y en sus barrios aledaños ya que el tiene experiencia en el la panaderia, y tambien ya un mercado de clientes conocidos.
texts.en: Edwin is 31 years old, single, and a very hard-working person.  He lives in Villa Israel, a very poor neighborhood in a depressed area on the outskirts of the city, in Cochabamba department.  This is where his small home and small bakery are located.  He has an oven where he makes bread from very early in the morning so that he can deliver it before 9.00am to the stores and schools.  His profit margin is very small owing to his small production.  In addition, he cannot compete with the large bakeries who come in vehicles to deliver their bread to the same stores that he delivers to.  For this reason, Edwin needs a loan which will allow him to buy more supplies and stock up with flour, butter, salt, oil, yeast and sugar so that he can double or triple his production to sell in his area and in nearby neighborhoods.  He has experience in the bakery business and also has a market of existing customers.

loans.use: to have working capital for his bakery

loans.name: Las Tres Rosas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las tres Rosas lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Elvira de Jesús  de 49 años quien tiene un pequeño bar (cafetin) en el parque en el cual ha trabajado desde hace 8 años. Ella está casada y tiene dos hijos por los cuales trabaja arduamente para sacarlos adelante.
Las otras integrantes una de ellas es Dominga quien vende bebidas típicas pinol, pinolillo, y tamales, yoltamal…etc. Y Victoria quien tiene una pulpería.
texts.en:
'Las tres Rosas' group is made up of three hard-working and entrepreneurial people.  One of them is 49-year-old Elvira de Jesús who has a small cafe in the park where she has worked for eight years.  She is married and has two children.  She works hard to provide for them.

The other members of the group are Dominga, who sells traditional drinks, 'pinol', 'pinolillo' (sweet cornmeal and cacao-based drinks), tamales, 'yoltamales' (corn tamales), etc. and Victoria who has a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy bread, snacks, bologna, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao is fifty-two years old and has three children at high-school and secondary school. She manages a wood workshop that makes furniture. Her business started ten years ago and creates a good income for family. 

Participating in our credit program since 2005, she used her loans to buy machines and some tools that serve the manufacturing process. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 8,502,000 VND to buy wood.

loans.use: to buy wood for her furniture workshop.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es: La señora  Gabriela  es  clienta  distinguida  de la institución   a lo largo de sus  créditos  se  a  caracterizado por   tener  una  excelente  cultura  de pagos, en esta  ocasión requiere  de  nuestra ayuda  para   realizar  su proyecto ,  el cual  consiste  en   impermeabilizar la  losa  de   su casa  ya  que nos  comenta  que  en  esta  épocas  de   lluvia  a  entrado el agua a su  vivienda,  agradece  el  apoyo brindado  para  hacer  de  su sueño una  realidad   ya  que  ve  en el  crédito la posibilidad  de   brindar  a  su  hija  una  mayor  estabilidad.
texts.en: Gabriela is an outstanding client of our institution.  Throughout her loan history, she has maintained an excellent repayment record.  On this occasion, she needs our help to carry out a project of waterproofing the concrete slab in front of her home because she tells us that during the rainy season the water enters her home.  She is grateful for the support that she is receiving to make her dream come true.  She sees in the loan the possibility to provide her daughter with more stability.

loans.use: to waterproof a concrete slab

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
This is Sonia, fifty-four, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. Single, she manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her daily expenses.
  
Sonia operates a room/apartment rental business. She currently manages four room units inside her apartment that local students and employees rent on a monthly basis. She earns a minimum of 2,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in rentals every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 28,000 loan. She will use the loan to repair and maintain her room-for-rent units. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Sonia dreams to be able to add more business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the repair and maintenance of her apartment units.

loans.name: Vui

texts.en: Vui is thirty years old with one small son. She is a farmer, and grows rice and raises chickens for meat. She also works doing chores for other people. Though former clients, she heard about SEDA's credit program and she thought that it could be suitable for her business. She is requesting a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy baby chickens to raise

loans.use: to buy baby chickens to raise.

loans.name: Anhtsetseg

texts.en:
Anhtsetseg is thirty-one years old and lives with her husband and a son in Dornod province in Eastern Mongolia. Her husband works in the armed forces and her son studies at the local secondary school. She has been working in a hairdressing saloon since 2008. Every month she pays to rent the room. She has become a well-known hairdresser in the area. 

In order to expand her business, she would like to buy the necessary tools and equipment. She is a talented hairdresser who says that "I would like to expand my business so that I can supply the customers with better service and improve my income and our family's livelihood". 

The total amount she is requesting is 600,000 MNT to buy tools for the salon.

loans.use: To purchase tools for her hair salon.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo, forty-three, is married with three children. He lives Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental.

Alfredo is in the transportation business, operating a motorcycle cab. He has been in this business for three years. and he finds that the income is great. He has a net income of 3,200 PHP per month. He has no other business. This is the primary source of income for his family.

Alfredo joined GDMPC in 2011 to gain access to financing. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchased motorcycle spare parts like wheels and a headlight. The loans have had a great impact on the family, helping to improve their living situation. Alfredo's plan for his business is to put his best efforts into making it sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts like wheels and a headlight.

loans.name: Gal-Ochir

texts.en:
Gal-Ochir is fifty-four years old and lives with her husband and a son in Govisumber province in Southern Mongolia. Her husband is retired and her son goes to the high school. She has worked as a cook, and for the last three years, she has been retailing dairy products and food. She runs a food cart business in summertime. But the income is not sufficient for the family needs and daily living expenses due to the low income and the seasonal nature of the work. 

Therefore, she is planning to expand the business to take advantage of the approaching lunar calendar new year festival in Mongolia. Gal-Ochir is a bright woman who says that "I would like to expand my business so that I can earn more for the family and save for my only child's future. I need support to get my supplies". 

The total amount she is requesting is 500,000 MNT for the supplies.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien is thirty-five years old and has two small children. Her main activity focuses on growing rice and raising pigs for meat. Her business started ten years ago. 

Becoming a client of SEDA in 2006, she used loans effectively for cultivation and raising pigs. For this new loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy food for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs.

loans.name: Mai's Group

texts.en:
Mai, 48, has one child who is grown up. Being a farmer, she grows rice and raises chickens, a business she has run for many years. Since joining the credit program in 2004, she has used loans to expand her farming activity. She now wants a loan of 6,322,000 Vietnamese đồng (VND) to buy food for her chickens.

Van, 34, has two school-age children and runs a shop where she cuts hair. She wants a loan of 6,322,000 VND to buy more hair products and machines to expand her shop.

Bac, 29, has three school age children. She raises chickens and wants a loan of 6,322,000 VND to buy food for them.

Thuy, 48, has two children. She raises pigs and would like a loan of 6,322,000 VND to buy food for them.

loans.use: to buy food for her chickens.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia de 41 años de edad, está casado con Roberto de 46 años, que fruto de este amor tienen 3 hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Llochegua. Lidia se dedica al cultivo de café desde hace más de 20 años. Esta labor lo aprendió de sus padres, provenientes de una familia que por tradición realizan esta actividad. Frecuentemente trabaja con el apoyo de su esposo y algunos peones que requiere en épocas de cosecha y mantenimiento de su parcela agrícola. Ella está contenta con esta labor que realiza, porque le genera un buen ingreso económico, por tanto desea abrir una tienda de abarrotes, pero tiene un inconveniente que su casa aun no esta adecuada como para una tienda, por lo que primero terminará de construirlo. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles realizará el mantenimiento de su parcela de café, para ello contratará peones.
texts.en:
41-year-old Lidia is married to 46-year-old Roberto and has three children.  They live together in their own home, in Llochegua district.  

Lidia's business is growing coffee.  She has been doing this for more than 20 years.  She learned how to do this work from her parents as they come from a family who have traditionally carried out this business activity.  Lidia frequently works with the support of her husband and some laborers whose help she needs during harvest seasons and when she needs maintenance work carried out on her plot of farmland.  Lidia is happy with the work that she does because it makes her good income.  She would like to open a grocery store but she faces a problem in that her house is still not suitable for setting up a store.  First she will have to finish some building work.

This is Lidia's first loan from MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time.  She will use her 1,000 soles to maintain her coffee crops.  She will hire laborers to do this.

loans.use: to hire laborers

loans.name: Perli Grace

texts.en:
Perli Grace is thirty-one years old and lives in Bonifacio Misamis Occidental. She is married and blessed with two children. Her husband is a farmer. She established her own small business to help support her husband and generate income for the family. Perli Grace works in the agricultural business, raising pigs to sell commercially. She has been active in this business for two years and has generated a good return to date, to the amount of 4,600 PHP.

She joined GDMPC and applied for a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase feed for the growth and nourishment of her pigs. She plans that in the near future a portion of the income generated will be reinvested into the business so it can expand.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the growth and nourishment of her pigs.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is thirty-nine years old with two children who are in high-school. She is managing a small wood workshop that makes furniture. Her business started six years ago and creates a good income for the family. 

Participating in our credit program since 2005, she used loans to buy machines and some tools that serve for the furniture-making process. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 9,810,000 VND to buy wood.

loans.use: to buy wood for her workshop.

loans.name: Uuganchimeg

texts.en: Uuganchimeg, 28, lives with her husband and two children in the Govisumber province in Southern Mongolia. Her husband is a herder and their two children study in secondary school. She has been in garment retailing for three years. As they have four seasons in Mongolia, she would like to increase her sorts of goods so that her customers will be satisfied with the goods and service. Uuganchimeg is a good-natured woman who says, "I would like to expand the business and keep it successful by getting supplies in large quantities and in different sorts. I have a plan to start saving for my daughter's future." In total, she is requesting 1,730,000 Mongolian Tugrik (MNT) for the clothes.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for spring.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Monsieur Adama est un jeune vigile âgé de 32 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants : l’un de 2 ans et le tout dernier qui est la cause de sa demande de prêt : un nouveau né qu’il veut baptiser. Adama travaille comme vigile depuis maintenant 8 ans. Avec ses revenus il  arrive à gérer sa petite famille. Mais cela ne suffit pas avec les maigres salaires de gardien ; c’est pourquoi  il aimerait faire une autre activité parallèle celui de d’élever  des bœufs pour pouvoir améliorer les conditions  de vie de sa famille
texts.en: Mr Adama is a young  security guard aged 32, who is married and has 2 children : one of 2 years and the new baby who is the reason for his request for a loan : a newborn child that he wishes to baptise.Adama  has been working as a security guard for 8 years now. With his income he can manage  his little family  .However  he is a bit hard up with his meagre salary as a security vigil; which is why he would like to add another activity ,that of breeding cattle, in order to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to baptise his son

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 47 years old and married with two children.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family.  She buys and sells clothes in the Philippines and requests a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase more clothing to sell.

Jocelyn has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been in business for four years and also earns an income from buying and selling bananas.

Jocelyn aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is twenty-nine years old and married with two children.

Mary Grace works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Mary Grace has borrowed and paid for seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buying and selling of ready-to-wear business for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

Mary Grace aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en: Luz is 58 years old and a widow with one child. She works very hard to provide for them. Luz runs a sari sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell. Luz has been in this business for 37 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, noodles, sardines, spices, etc. In the future, Luz would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim, 29, is the mother of a lovely young child and lives in Kompong Cham province, where she makes a living as a local rice cultivator, whereas her husband is a motor-taxi driver around the province. Her husband is sociable and very honest in provide his services to the local people as well to strangers. There are thus many customers who prefer to use his service. Together, they are able to generate a good income to support the family.

Currently, her husband's motorcycle has some mechanical problems, which has affected his daily business. Thus, Kim would like to take a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a new motorcycle to replace the broken one. She is very thankful.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to stock her business with merchandise

loans.name: Rosalbina

texts.es:
Rosalbina de 46 años, está casada con Bernardo con quien tiene 6 hijos peros solo vive con 2 de 17 y 15 años. Rosalbina y si familia viven en una casa propia en el anexo de Huaripampa, distrito de Palca, provincia de Tarma. Rosalbina es una mujer que le agrada el trabajo del campo. A pesar de lo duro y cansado que puede ser, manifiesta su inclinación por las actividades productivas y de comercialización. Sus más de 20 años dedicados a la agricultura le han enseñado lo esencial para cultivar sus productos desafiando al clima y a las temporadas de escasez de lluvias. Por esa razón ahora siembra papas, arvejas y gladiolos, siendo estos 3 productos los que más satisfacción le han brindado. “El gladiolo es bien rentable, se cosecha 2 veces al año y cualquier mes puede sembrarse”, menciona. Rosalbina no se preocupa de trasladar sus flores hasta la ciudad de Tarma, ya que, por la gran demanda de estas flores, los mismos compradores vienen hasta su localidad para negociar un precio considerable.  Ahora, ella sembrará gladiolos y espera que estén listos para mayo, ya que es uno de los meses donde las flores alcanzan su precio más alto. Sería su crédito número 13 que obtendría gracias a su ayuda, de MFP. Da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Está agradecida y contenta con su banco comunal “La Libertad de Huaripampa”, por el trabajo en equipo.
Con el dinero del préstamo podrá comprar semillas de flores de gladiolos, así como algunas bolsas de abonos para garantizar su crecimiento.
texts.en:
Rosalbina, aged 46, is married to Bernardo with whom she has six children, but only two of them (17 and 15 years old) live with her. Rosalbina and her family live in their own house in Huaripampa, a neighborhood in the district of Palca in the province of Tarma.

Rosalbina is a woman who likes field work. Despite how hard and tiring her work can be, she likes producing and selling farm products. Her more than 20 years in agriculture have taught her the essentials about farming in an environment of unfavorable climate and seasons with low rainfall. For that reason she now grows potatoes, peas and gladioli, because these three products give her the most satisfaction. "Gladioli are very profitable. They can be harvested twice a year and be planted any month," she says. Rosalbina does not care to transport the flowers to the city of Tarma, because they are in high demand there and the merchants are ready to travel to her village and negotiate a substantial price. Now she will plant gladioli and expects them to be ready in May, because May is one of the months with the highest flower prices.

This loan would be her thirteenth with the microfinance institution Microfinanzas Prisma. She gives her word to be punctual with paying the installments. She is grateful and happy with her communal bank "La Libertad de Huaripampa" (the freedom of Huaripampa) because of the teamwork. She will use the loan to buy gladiolus seeds and a few bags of fertilizer to ensure growth.

loans.use: to buy gladiolus seeds and a few bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 44 years old and married with seven children.

Juliet works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Juliet has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has run her general store for 13 years and also earns an income from electronic re-loading and fishing.

Juliet aspires to save enough to provide a secure future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Lourdes has a tailoring shop that makes and sells curtains and pillow cases.  She has been in business for 11 years.  

She requests a loan for 10,000 to buy materials needed for her tailoring shop.  Lourdes has been a member of HSPFI since 2008.  

In the future, Lourdes hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 67 years old and married with five children.

Lilia works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines and requests a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Lilia has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running her sari-sari store for three years and also earns an income from fishing.

Lilia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a married man. He has five children, ages 4 years to 15. He describes himself as an honest man. 

Paul sells paraffin and has been in business for 14 years.  He sells in a busy area and his primary customers are middle earners.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be the delay of payments from customers.  

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more paraffin to sell.  Paul's  business goal is to expand his business and create job opportunities within five years.

loans.use: to purchase more paraffin to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 38 years old and married with 3 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 15 years.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Nenita is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is 47 years old and married with 2 children. Nimfa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her store. She has been running the sari sari store for 10 years.

She has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save money so she could send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Alivita

texts.en:
Alivita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years. Alivita earns more income from raising pigs.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She wants to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia, 43, is a widow with two school age children. She lives in the small village of Bonifacio, Misamis Oddicental. Her family is doing well despite the hardships they are experiencing without the help and support of her husband. She is in the retail business and runs what is locally known as 'sari-sari' store. She has been in this business for five years and has a proven track record of being able to generate revenue. She joined GDMPC to gain financial access to engage in further business activities and expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase supplementary grocery items to sell in her store. She is hoping that through her income, she can further support the education of her children until college.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a 32-year-old married woman. She describes herself to be God-fearing and honest. She operates a retail business where she sells coconut. She has been involved in this business for 8 months. Her business is located in a prime area and her main customers are hotels. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve her business. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to purchase more coconut for selling. Her business goal is to be a coconut distributor within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more coconut for selling.

loans.name: Julia Esperanza

texts.es:
En el cantón Olmedo de la Provincia de Manabí cada quince días  se reúne el Banco Comunal Esfuerzo y Poder, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Julia, tiene 59 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 14 hijos, 13 de ellos ya son  mayores de edad, el menor tiene 15 años y es quien aun  vive con ella y estudia en colegio. Su marido es albañil y trabaja eventualmente.

Ella tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa en el cual vende empanadas, corviches, gaseosas, helados y otras bebidas, trabaja todas las tardes desde las 15h00 hasta las 20h00, en su local tiene dos mesas de billar y las personas se reúnen con la finalidad de entretenerse y conversar un momento, allí trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo, lleva más de 8 años con su negocio y gracias a el a podido para salir adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar plátano, maní, gaseosas y otros víveres necesarios para preparar los alimentos. Lleva más de 9 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda.

Su sueño es que su hijo menor termine sus estudios y que sea una persona de bien.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 'Esfuerzo y Poder' community bank meet in Olmedo canton, in Manabí province.  This area is known for its beautiful landscape and its hard-working people who farm and raise livestock.

Here we meet Julia.  She is 59 years old, married, and has 14 children from her marriage.  13 of her children are now adults.  Her youngest is 15 years old and still lives with her.  He attends high school.  Her husband is a builder and works on a casual basis.

Julia has a small business in her in her home where she sells empanadas, 'corviche', iced treats, soda and other drinks.  She works every afternoon, from 3.00pm to 8.00pm.  She also has two pool tables in her premises and people meet there to have fun and chat a while.  Julia works there with her husband's help.  She has been in her business for more than eight years and it has enabled her to get ahead in life.

Julia will use this loan to buy plantains, peanuts, soda and other food products that she needs for making her food.  She has been a member of her community bank for nine loan cycles and she likes it because the loans are very helpful.  

Julia's dream is for her youngest son to finish his studies and become an upstanding citizen.

loans.use: to buy plantains, peanuts, soda and other food products

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 49 years old and married with 3 children. She earns a living by selling seaweeds cultured in the Philippines. Erlinda has been selling cultured seaweed for 6 years and also earns additional income from fish vending. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase bamboo, plastic wire and other materials for her business. Erlinda is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase bamboo, plastic wire and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is 62 years old and married with 8 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Eugenia has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 2 years and also earns an income from selling seaweed. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 63 years old and married with 4 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell. 

She has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from electronic re-loading. Evelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Shirly has a pigpen ans she sells grown, matured pigs.  She has been in business for 10 years.  She requests a loan for 9,000 for animal feed.

Shirly has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Shirly hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Ligaya

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Ma. Ligaya works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling seaweed. Ma. Ligaya is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase a fishing net and other fishing materials for her business.

Ma. Ligaya has been sustaining her business activities via 13 previous loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net and other fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Leonida has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.  She has had this business for two years.  Leonida requess a loan for 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Leonida has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Leonida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Purification

texts.en:
Purification is 68 years old, married with 5 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Purification has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. She requests a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets.

She has been in business for 10 years.  In the future, Purification would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad is a hardworking entrepreneur who buys and sells shells and seaweed, in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional shells and seaweed to sell for her business.

Soledad has been in business for 30 years. She earns more income from food vending.

Soledad has been sustaining her business through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional shells and seaweed to sell for her business.

loans.name: María Lastenia

texts.es:
La señora María, tiene 40 años, tiene 2 hijas de 15 y 18 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con sus hijas en la comunidad 2 de Julio en el Municipio de Petoa, Santa Barbara.
Doña María se dedica desde hace 3 años a la venta de comida (pollo frito, refrescos y churros), dedicando 11 horas diarias de trabajo continúo. 
Con su propio esfuerzo y la ayuda financiera a través de préstamos, inicio su negocio de venta de comida con el objetivo de obtener un mejoramiento económico familiar.
En la actualidad ha solicitado un crédito por la cantidad de 12,000 Lempiras los cuales piensa invertir en la compra de productos de la canasta basica para preparar sus alimentos.
Ella esta muy optimista ya que sus ventas han aumentado por lo que espera hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
María, age 40, has two daughters, ages 15 and 18.  She is a single mother.  She lives with her daughters in the 2 de Julio community in the Petoa municipality, Santa Barbara.

María has been selling food (fried chicken, soft drinks, and churros) for three years.  She works 11 straight hours daily.  Through her own effort and the help of the loans, she started her business of selling food.  Her objective was to improve the family’s financial situation.

She has recently requested a loan for 12,000 lempiras to buy staples to prepare her food.  She is very optimistic because her sales have increased, and she consequently hopes to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy staples to prepare food.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa lives in Jacobs Town,  is 29-years-old and is married with three children aged 9 to 14 years old. The children are in school and live at home. For the past four years Hawa has been selling lappa (traditional material for clothing) in the local market. She started this business with help from her husband. She makes more profit and has more customers since she sells quality lappa. She is requesting a loan to purchase more lappa for her business. She plans to educate her children and build.

loans.use: to purchase more lappa (traditional material for clothing) for her business.

loans.name: Simukai-Mutare Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe!  This is 57 year old Enitta from Mutare.  She is married with six children; two attend school. 

Enitta runs a retail business selling clothes that she buys from South Africa.  Her business has been in operation for 15 years.  She says the main challenge she faces is transport costs. 

Enitta has requested a loan of $800 to buy more clothes for resale.  She says the extra income generated from this loan will allow her to improve the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ratna Sari Group

texts.en:
To increase the business and the population of her pigs, Ni Putu is continuing to borrow a loan from MUK. She will use the loan to purchase superior piglets and renovate the pigpen. With assistance from MUK, she wants to pursue this business more seriously.

Her husband works as a farmer, but he also supports his wife's business. With this venture she dreams of being able to use the profits to fix her house.

loans.use: To purchase superior piglets and renovate the pigpen.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 33-years-old and married. He and his wife have 3 children and live in Hioma, Uganda. He owns a business of buying and selling clothes which he has been doing for 8 months. He faces a challenge of price fluctuations. His family goal is to educate his children and build a permanent house for his family. He dreams of expanding his business to new markets and also diversifying his business to include children's clothes. Samuel needs the loan to buy clothes for sellng.

loans.use: to buy clothes for selling.

loans.name: Sarain

texts.en: Sarain, 61, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in an agricultural business for over twenty years, growing agricultural crops and fattening cattle. They have extensive experience and are successful in their career. Four of her children are employed at a garment factory. In order to improve her family’s finances, Sarain is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a Tuk Tuk for her oldest son to run a transportation service to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business and rebuild her present house to make it bigger and stronger to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a Tuk Tuk for her oldest son to run a transportation service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fuel at a wholesale price.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is from Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years of age, married, and has three school-age children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agricultural sector raising and harvesting corn for sale. She sells her harvested corn to the public market in her town. She has been in this business for 13 years and earns approximately 4,300 PHP per month. This is her primary source of income. 

She came to the GDMPC office and applied for a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer to enhance the growth of her corn. Judith's revenue will be reinvested back into her business to double the return, and a portion of the profit will be used for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to enhance growth on her corn farm.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. Alma is providing motorela or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 6 years. 

She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service. Alma has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

loans.name: Wiguna Merta Group

texts.en:
Now the Wiguna Merta group has 8 members. One of them resigned to follow her husband to another city. The group is continuing the loan to increase their pig population. They will use the loan to purchase piglets, a sow and feed.

Ni Ketut will use her loan to purchase a sow. She has made a plan: the sow will give birth three months from the day she bought it. She has a plan to become a piglet seller. She hopes the new business will do well and she can sell many piglets.

loans.use: To purchase a sow

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 35 year old married man. He has two children, ages 3 and 15 year.  He describes himself as a self-motivated man. 

He repairs motor vehicles.  He has been in business for five years.  His primary customers are public service vehicle owners.  Charles is also a farmer.  Charles says his biggest business challenge is insufficient funds to improve his business, in order to meet his customers' needs. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase a tool box.  Charles' business goal is to run a big spare parts shop within five years.

loans.use: to purchase a tool box.

loans.name: Kelier Geovany

texts.es:
El joven Kelier trabaja como docente del Ministerio de Educación  desde hace 5 años, cuenta con el apoyo de su familia ya que  son bien unidos y profesan la religion catolica, es considerado como una  persona  bien responsable y de buen vivir, actualmente se encuentra estudiando el y su esposa, ambos son personas bien luchadoras que a pesar que tienen que viajar a estudiar a Nueva Guinea a recibir sus clases, ya que su meta es finalizar sus estudios universitarios.  

Esta solicitando su 2do crédito para comprar un solar en la colonia Providencia, para poco a poco ir construyendo su propia vivienda, pues su mayor sueño en la vida es tener su propio hogar digno como toda persona lo sueña para el y su familia.
texts.en:
Kelier is a young man who has been working as a teacher for the Ministry of Education for 5 years.  He has the support of his family as they are a very united, Catholic family.  Kelier is considered to be a very responsible and clean-living person.  He and his wife are currently studying.  They are very tenacious people who study even though they must travel to Nueva Guinea to do so because their goal is to finish their university studies.

Kelier is requesting his second loan to buy a plot of land in Providencia so that he can gradually build his own home.  His biggest dream in life is to have a decent home of his own for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin, a 23-year-old single man, has been farming for eight years, producing and selling milk and eggs at the local market. He also operates a motorcycle taxi business commonly known as a ”bodaboda”.

Kevin has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a chuff (straw/hay} cutter to help in the feeding of his dairy cows. He is planning to use the income to meet family needs. Kevin says that farmers are facing challenges of access to funds, although Juhudi Kilimo loans are mitigating this major problem.

loans.use: to buy a chuff cutter.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en: Marlene, a 38-year-old married mother of four, lives in the Philippines where she has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products from NATASHA and AVON. In business for 10 years, she is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more stocks from NATASHA and AVON to sell. Marlene, a member of HSPFI since 2011, hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy stocks from NATASHA & AVON to sell.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 52 years old and married. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Cristina has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Cristina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married and has one child. She lives in the coastal town of Malindi, Kenya. She owns a salon that has been in operation for five years. She started it off through her own savings.

Margaret knew Milango through her friends and her aim is to access credit to improve her business. Her challenge is the high cost of purchasing stock for her business. She is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a new stocks of cosmetics. Her extra income will be used for emergency purposes. She looks forward to opening a boutique in future.

loans.use: to buy new stocks of cosmetics.

loans.name: Fedila

texts.en:
Fedila is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Fedila has a pigpen and she sells grown & matured pigs. She also has a vegetable garden and she sells vegetables every harvest time. She has had these businesses for 20 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy animal feed for the pigs & fertilizers for the vegetable garden.

Fedila has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Fedila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs & fertilizers for the vegetable garden

loans.name: Turbadrah

texts.en: Turbadrah, 30, lives with his wife and two children in Western Mongolia. His wife makes construction decorations from March to December and their two children are in secondary school. He started providing intercity transportation in 2008 and sometimes he drives his van for the taxi service in the cities. Now, he plans to get his own motor coach so that he could earn more and expand the business. Turbadrah is a bright guy who says, "I would like to expand my business to make a higher income and improve my family's livelihood. I am planning to spend my savings to buy the motor coach but still need some financial support." The total amount he is requesting is 2,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to buy the motor coach.

loans.use: to buy a motor coach.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida is 41 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Brigida is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to raise.

Brigida has been raising livestock for 10 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en: Rosela, 44, is from the village of Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is married and blessed with four children. Rosela's husband is a farmer and she  works in an agricultural business project raising domestic animals (primarily pigs) to earn an income. She has been in this business for three years and earns about 7,800 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month. Rosela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services from the cooperative as additional investment for her business. She requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase feed for her domestic pigs for their growth and good nourishment. Rosela plans that the income generated from her loan will be invested back into the business and ultimately hopes to expand her business. Additionally, Rosela hopes that the continued success of her business will allow her to care for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her domestic pigs for their growth and good nourishment.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Myra has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, beverages & vegetables. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, beverages & vegetables.

Myra has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Myra hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, beverages & vegetables

loans.name: Gloria Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Gloria, tiene 44 años, tiene 1 hijo de 15 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive en la comunidad de Rio Blanco en el Municipio de San Pedro Sula, Cortes.
Doña Gloria vive en compañía de su hijo y de su madre, anteriormente ella trabajaba en una fabrica maquiladora de ropa, con el dinero de las prestaciones laborales inicio su negocio de venta de ropa de segunda.
Ella ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 6,000 Lempiras, el cual piensa invertir en la compra de un fardo de ropa. 
Manifiesta estar satisfecha con su actividad económica, ya que las utilidades son muy buenas, ella vende la ropa en su vivienda pero también sale a vender ambulante y trabaja mucho por encargos que le hacen sus clientes.
Ella tiene el deseo de profesionalizar a su hijo y seguir creciendo como comerciante.
texts.en:
Gloria, age 44, has one child, age 15.  She is a single mother.  She lives in the Rio Blanco community in the San Pedro Sula municipality, Cortes.

Gloria lives with her son and her mother.  She previously worked in a clothing factory.  She used her severance pay to start her business of selling second-hand clothes.

She has requested a loan for 6,000 lempiras to buy a bundle of clothing.  She states that she is satisfied with her business activity because the profits are very good.  She sells clothes at her home, but she also goes out and sells in an itinerant manner.  She works a lot by orders from her customers.

She wishes for her son to become a professional and to continue growing as a merchant.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Arselita

texts.en:
Arselita, 38, is married with three children and works hard to provide for her family. She runs a retail business in the Philippines selling rice and has requested a loan of 29,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Arselita has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running her rice retailing business for two years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Arselita aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
Doña Cirila 42 años de edad, labora como conserje desde hace 9 años desempeñandose con gran eficiencia y honestidad, su esposo la ayuda con los gastos del hogar y con los deberes crediticios, el se dedica a la siembra de cultivos agricolas en union con su familia, donde obtiene ingresos adicionales para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
Cirla solicita su 2do credito para comprar un pequeño solar ubicado en la colonia Naciones Unidas, pues su mayor sueño en la vida es poder brindarle a su familia un hogar digno y que esta permanezca unida, con salud y tener estabilidad laboral ya que es dificil encontrar trabajo.
texts.en:
42-year-old Cirila has been working as a caretaker for nine years.  She carries out her work with great efficiency and integrity.  Her husband helps her with their household expenses and with meeting their loan obligations.  Cirila grows crops together with her family.  This makes her additional income with which to cover the household expenses.

Cirila is requesting her second loan to buy a small plot of land in the Naciones Unidas development as her biggest dream in life is to provide her family with a decent home and for them to remain united and healthy with stability in their work as it is difficult to find work.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene, casada, mujer emprendedora, humilde y trabajadora tiene su propio negocio de ventas de cosméticos y de productos por encargos. Sus planes mejorar su condiciones de vida, para que sus hijos obtén a un mejor futuro. También a cambiar la infraestructura de la vivienda a un largo plazo siendo requerido realizar. 
Con este préstamo comprar mercadería como: ropa de uniforme escolar, artículos escolares, perfumes, body, pintura de labios, cejas, y mejías, cremas de cuerpo, mano y cara, pantalones, camisa, camiseta, calcetas, blusas, faldas entre otros productos. Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio e ir cumpliendo con sus planes de crear un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Marlene is married.  She is a modest, entrepreneurial and hard-working woman who has her own business selling cosmetics and other products to order.  Her plan is to improve her living conditions so that her children can enjoy a better future.  She would also like to make changes to her home's infrastructure in the long term because it needs doing.  

Marlene will use this loan to buy merchandise such as clothing, school uniforms, school supplies, perfume, bodysuits, lipsticks, eyeshadows, blusher, body creams, hand creams, face creams, pants, shirts, t-shirts, socks, blouses, skirts and other products.  She is grateful to the financial institution for the support that they are giving her in developing her business and carrying out her plans for creating a better future for her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (new clothing, school uniforms and other products)

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia, a 46-year-old married mother of two, works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a sari-sari store for four years and also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Amalia, who has borrowed and repaid seven previous loans from NWTF, is now requesting a PHP 15,000 loan to purchase additional stocks to sell. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional store stocks to sell.

loans.name: Solymar Arleth

texts.es:
Solymar es una dama soltera que reside en Nandasmo municipio del departamento de Masaya, madre soltera el cual tiene un hijo. 

Actualmente está necesitando remodelar su vivienda y darle una mejor condición de vida a su hijo, y sentirse satisfecha por dicha labor. Por ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción entre los que se encuentran cemento, pintura, piso, zinc, arena, etc.

Es importante mencionar que por medio de dicho crédito, le brindará a su familia un techo digno donde habitar y así salir adelante en su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Solymar is a single woman who lives in the town of Nandasmo in the department of Masaya.  She is a single mother to one son.

She needs to remodel her home to provide better living conditions for her son and to feel satisfied by this work.  In order to do this, she has come to Ceprodel to request a loan to purchase construction materials, including cement, paint, flooring, zinc, sand, and other items.

It is important to mention that this loan will allow her family to have a decent place to live so that they can get ahead in their development.

loans.use: to purchase cement, paint, flooring, zinc, sand, and other items.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes de 33 años de edad convive con Teofilo de 33 años; fruto de esta relación tienen 4 hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Periavente alta del distrito de Llochegua. Lourdes es una perseverante mujer que con mucho esfuerzo trata de sacar adelante a sus menores hijos, pues se dedica al cultivo de café y cacao juntamente con su querido esposo. En un principio solo tenían cafetales pero como vieron que el cacao también trae rentabilidad, decidieron comprar semillas de cacao que ahora se aprovechan los frutos y eso también le genera más ingresos. Lourdes está feliz con los cultivos que tiene, pues gracias a ello ha logrado obtener muchos beneficios y darles el bienestar a su querida familia. Este será su segundo préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Lourdes está contento con su banco comunal por que son puntuales. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles realizará el mantenimiento de su parcela de cacao y café, para ello contratará peones.
texts.en:
Lourdes, 33 years old, lives with Teofilo, who is also 33 years old.  They have four children.  They live together in their own house located in the community of Periavente Alta in the Llochegua district.  Lourdes is a woman who perseveres.  She works very hard to try to improve the lives of her young children.  

She works cultivating coffee and cacao along with her husband.  At the beginning, they only had coffee plants, but they saw that cacao was also profitable, so they decided to buy cacao seeds, which are now bearing fruit and earning more income for them.  Lourdes is happy with the crops that they have because thanks to them they have been able to obtain many benefits and give their family well-being.  

This will be her second loan with MFP and she promises to make all of her payments on time.  Lourdes is happy with her community bank because they are all punctual.  

With the 3,000 nuevos soles that she is requesting, she will hire laborers to tend her cacao and coffee crops.

loans.use: to hire laborers.

loans.name: Juana Julia

texts.es:
En el cantón Olmedo de la Provincia de Manabí cada quince días  se reúne el Banco Comunal Esfuerzo y Poder, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Juana, tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 6 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su marido es comerciante.

Ella es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito tanto para el negocio de su marido como para realizar mejoras en su hogar, su esposo se dedica a la venta de agua de coco, para lo cual tiene una carreta en la cual todos los días se dedica a la venta de esta deliciosa fruta en el centro de la ciudad. También ella va a utilizar una parte del crédito para poder construir el piso en su casa ya que es de tierra, con todos los créditos que ha recibido ella ha podido ir construyendo su hogar.

Este crédito es para comprar cocos para el negocio de su esposo y cemento, arena y otros materiales de construcción para poner el piso de su casa. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos poco a poco ha construido su casa.

Su sueño es terminar su casita.
texts.en:
In the Olmedo canton in the Manabi province, the Esfuerzo y Poder community bank meets every two weeks.  This area is known for its beautiful landscapes and for its hardworking people who work in agriculture and raising animals.

In this place we meet Juana, who is 57 years old, married, and has six adult and independent children.  Her husband is a salesman.

She is a very good wife because she is requesting this credit both for her husband's business and to complete repairs on their home.  Her husband works selling coconut water.  He has a cart where he sells this delicious fruit every day in the center of the city.  She also wants to use part of the loan to build a floor in their home, since right now it has a dirt floor.  With all of the loans she has received, she has been able to slowly construct their home.

This loan to is purchase coconuts for her husband's business and cement, sand, and other construction materials to put in a floor in her house.  She has been a member of the community bank since the beginning and she likes it because she has slowly been able to build her house with the loans.

Her dream is to finish her house.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts as well as construction materials such as cement and sand.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Don Francisco Javier se desempeña como albañil permanente en  Lácteos el Zapote desde hace 7 años,  su esposa se encarga de realizar los quehaceres del hogar y de atender a sus 3 hijos. Su familia se caracteriza por ser muy unida y con buenos sentimientos, ademas es muy querido por sus compañeros de trabajo y vecinos que es un hombre de buen vivir, que ha luchado en la vida por seguir adelante.                                                                         

Este crèdito lo requiere para realizar reparaciones en su vivienda, repellando las paredes de los cuartos para fortalecerlas, ya que es uno de sus principales sueños en la vida mejorar sus condiciones de vida y de su familia, como tambien gozar de salud y estabilidad laboral para seguir ayudando a su familia .
texts.en:
Don Francisco Javier has worked as the permanent mason at the  Lácteos el Zapote dairy for seven years.  His wife takes care of the household and cares for their three children.  His family is very close and cares for each other.  He is also well liked by his coworkers and neighbors because he is a man who lives well.  He has struggled in life to get ahead.

He is requesting this loan to make repairs to his home.  He wants to plaster the walls of the rooms to strengthen them.  One of his main dreams in life is to improve living conditions for himself and his family, and also to enjoy good health and job stability to continue helping his family.

loans.use: to plaster the walls of his home.

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr:
Adjovi est une femme âgée de 39 ans. Elle est mariée å un militaire retraité.
Adjovi travaille comme revendeuse de charbons de bois depuis 1995. Elle vend seule à la maison à toutes personnes et achète à Lomé.
Adjovi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de charbons de bois. Elle veut aider son mari dans les charges du foyer.
texts.en:
Adjovi is a 39 year-old woman. She is married to a retired soldier
Adjovi has been working as a charcoal retailer since 1995. She sells alone from her house to a varied clientele, and purchases her supplies in Lomé.
Adjovi requested her first loan from WAGES in order to purchase bags of charcoal. She wants to help her husband with the household’s expenses.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal

loans.name: Haxleen

texts.en:
Haxleen is a 40-year-old married man. He has five children with ages ranging from 2 to 13 years. He describes himself to be courageous. 

He operates a club where he provides entertainment music. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located at a strategic and competitive area and his primary customers are schools, tourists, and politicians. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve the business. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase production items such as microphones and speakers. Haxleen's business goal is to run a big entertainment industry that attracts many tourists within five years.

loans.use: to buy production items such as microphones, speakers, etc.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Beatriz has a computer shop that provides Internet and online computer games. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for the electricity for the services.

Beatriz is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the electricity for the services.

loans.name: Frank John

texts.es:
Frank, tiene 30 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido, así como también su agricultura.  En su tiempo libre disfruta trabajar en el campo;  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que más le gusta es la riquísima “Sopa Bruta”  y el “Arroz con pollo”; Frank  estudió hasta quinto año de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Administración. 
	
"Frank con mucho esfuerzo logro tener su negocio de  Ferretería luego de un tiempo logro tener su negocio de venta de abarrotes, se dedica a este trabajo alrededor de 13 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 28 clientes al día, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque brinda un buen servicio y el carisma que tiene al vender. 

Frank agradece a los prestatarios Kiva ya que con su apoyo el podrá  comprar más mercadería para su negocio, lo que le permitirá tener mayor variedad de productos en su ferreteria y poder aumentar sus ingresos y así poder seguir luchando para  cumplir su gran sueño: “ Ampliar su ferretería."
texts.en:
Frank, 30 years old, lives in the city of Imperial, which is known for its warm climate and its agriculture.  In his free time, he likes to work in the fields.  As you know, Peru is known for having the most delicious foods in the world and one of the dishes he likes the best is the rich "Sopa Bruta" and chicken and rice.  Frank studied through the fifth year of secondary school, but he would have liked to study management.

With a lot of effort, Frank succeeded in having a hardware store.  Previously, he had a store that sold groceries.  He works at the store about 13 hours a day and he can serve 28 customers a day.  He thinks that he does well with his business because he provides good service and he sells with charisma.

Frank is grateful to the Kiva lenders, since with their support, he will be able to purchase more merchandise for his store.  This will allow him to have a greater variety of products in his hardware store and increase his income so that he can continue working towards his goal of expanding his store.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Amahoro Group

texts.fr:
Joseph  fait partie du groupe Amahoro. Il a 44 ans et il est marié, avec 5 enfants de 4 à 15 ans  dont 3 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de primaire.

Joseph est commerçant. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des articles de sa boutique et des vêtements à vendre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire des épargnes pour améliore son business et rembourser au temps pour pouvoir accéder au grand montant du crédit. Dans les prochaines années, Joseph voudrait être un grand commerçant. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser ses enfants et améliore le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Joseph is a member of group Amahoro. He is 44 years old and married, with five children between the ages of four and fifteen. Three of the children go to school. His own education consists in six years of primary school.

Joseph is in retail. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use his credit to purchase articles and clothing to retail in his shop.

His strategy to grow his business is to save money with which to improve the business, and to pay back his loan punctually in order to be eligible for larger loans. In the coming years, Joseph would like to become a major retailer. With the profits, he is planning on sending his children to school and to improve his family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy articles and clothes to retail in his shop.

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
 
Amor has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Amor is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for resale.

loans.name: Matano

texts.en:
Matano is a 41-year-old retail shop proprietor in Mariakani. He is married and the father of two school-going children. His business has been in operation for the past four years and it is doing great. 

This is his fourth business loan from KADET to finance his business. He plans to purchase more sugar, rice, cooking oil, and washing detergents. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business further and repay his loan. 

He hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, rice, cooking oil, and washing detergents.

loans.name: Agnélé

texts.fr:
Agnélé est une femme âgé(e) de 33 ans. Elle est mariée  å un  Directeur de société et ont 04 enfants.
Agnélé travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale et de friperies  depuis 2009. Elle vend toute seule à son domicile et achète à Lomé.
Agnélé a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des balles de friperies et des produits d’alimentation générale(riz, sucre, huile végétale et autres….)
texts.en:
Agnélé is a 33 year-old woman. She is married to a company manager and they have four children. 
Agnélé has been working as a retailer of grocery products and second-hand clothes since 2009. She sells by herself, from her home, and gets her supplies from Lomé.
Agnélé requested her first loan from WAGES to purchase bundles of used clothes and some food products (rice, sugar, vegetable oil, etc.)

loans.use: to purchase used clothes in bundles and groceries.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Belen has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Belen is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase merchandise so that she can expand her business.

loans.name: Mayra Petrona

texts.es:
Mayra de 31 años de edad labora como comercianta de venta de Ropa que ella misma confecciona  desde hace 8 años, su esposo es conductor, trabajan en conjunto ya que son una pareja bien unida que les gusta el progreso para sacar adelante a su familia.

Mayra solicita su 2do crédito para comprar un solar ubicado en la zona # 8 del municipio para poco a poco ir construyendo su propia vivienda, pues actualmente habitan en la casa de su mamà ya que ella se encuentra enferma y ella cuida de ella pero su mayor sueño es construir su propia vivienda para tener un patrimonio propio que dejar a sus hijos cuando los tenga.
texts.en:
Mayra, 31 years old, has worked for eight years selling clothing that she makes herself.  Her husband is a driver.  They work together since they are a united couple who makes progress toward getting their family ahead.

Mayra is asking for her second loan to purchase a plot of land in Zone #8 of the town to slowly build her own house.  They currently live in her mother's house since she is sick and Mayra is caring for her.  Her dream is to build her own house so that they have assets to give to their children.

loans.use: to purchase land to build a house.

loans.name: Feliz Rafael

texts.es: El señor Rafael , es habitante del municipo de Ticuantepe , junto a su familia , desde muy pequeño se a dedicado a los trabajos del campos , ya que su papá es agricultor , los planes hacia un futuro es poder diversifcar el cultivo , con el financiamiento obtenido quiere seguirle dando manatemiento su cultivo de piña , ya que gracias a Afodenic con fondo KIVA logro sacar una producción mejor , pero se vio afectado por el precio del mercado ya que tuvo un bajon de casi el 50 % debajo a su precio normal .Esto se debio a que el mercado esta incadido de frutas como mandarina , melones , naranjas y sandia ; espera que en su segundo corte el precio le se estabilize y pueda ontener mejores ganacias .
texts.en:
Rafael lives in the town of Ticuantepe with his family.  Since he was young, he has worked in the fields, since his father was a farmer.  In the future, he plans to diversify his crops.  

With the loan he is requesting, he wants to continue maintaining his pineapple crops.  Thanks to Afodenic with his Kiva loan, he has been able to increase production, but he was affected by the market price, which dropped almost 50% below the normal price.  This is because the market was flooded with fruits such as mandarins, melons, oranges, and watermelons.  He hopes that after his second harvest, the price will stabilize and he can earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a mother and a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya where she lives with her family of 6 children, all adults save for the last born who is still schooling. She has had over 20 years in active farming and produces mainly maize, sugarcane and milk.

Elizabeth has requested a loan of 30,000 KES which she intends to use to buy poultry birds. She is optimistic her years of active farming will make her succeed. She adds the prospects for success are also great because of the ready market for poultry products. She is focusing on owning rental houses.

High costs of inputs and and animal diseases are the major challenges

loans.use: to buy poultry birds

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a 30-year-old married man. His wife is a pharmacist. He has 2 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 4 years. He describes himself to be courageous. 

Thomas operates a retail business where he provides music performance lessons. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a competitive area and his primary customers are form four leavers students (secondary school). He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve the business. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase music equipment. His business goal is to expand his business and recruit more students within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more music equipment.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 26 and married with one child, age 1. She has been practicing mixed farming for 7 years and currently produces vegetables and maize. She says farming has improved her family living standards since she became active in the business.
