Hellen has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds. She says she will use the income to buy a dairy cow once the  poultry business is well-established. Hellen is glad farming has improved her family living standards.

She sees animal diseases as the major challenge in farming.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 10 children. 

Liza has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Liza is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Liza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Gertrudes has a junk shop that buys and sells recycled bottles of different kinds. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of recycled bottles to sell. Gertrudes is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Gertrudes hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of recycled bottles to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 7 children. 

Emma has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Emma is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Emma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for sale

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Esperanza, tiene 41 años, tiene 2 hijos de 18 y 9 años de edad, es madre soltera, reside en la comunidad Las Cascadas en el Municipio Choloma, Cortes.
Doña Esperanza vive en compañía de sus hijos, anteriormente ella trabajaba en una guardería. 
En la actualidad ella invirtió sus ahorros para dedicarse al negocio de venta de comida y golosinas como ser: pollo frito y carne con tajadas de banano, pastelitos, enchiladas, además ella vende churros y refrescos.
Ella ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 9,000 Lempiras, el cual piensa invertir en la compra de productos alimenticios para surtir su negocio. 
Manifiesta estar satisfecha con su actividad económica, ya que además de apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios ella también continúa estudiando.
texts.en:
Esperanza, age 41, has two children, ages 18 and 9.  She is a single mother.  She lives with her children in the Las Cascadas community in the Choloma municipality, Cortes.

She previously worked at a childcare facility.  She has currently invested her savings in her business of selling food and sweets like fried chicken, meat with plantain slices, pastries stuffed with meat, potatoes or rice, and enchiladas.  She also sells churros and soft drinks.

She has requested a loan for 9,000 lempiras to buy food products to stock her business.  She states that she is satisfied with her business activity because in addition to supporting her children’s education she, too, continues studying.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Egda Holanda

texts.es:
En el cantón Olmedo de la Provincia de Manabí cada quince días  se reúne el Banco Comunal Esfuerzo y Poder, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Egda, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 15, 13 y 7 años, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su marido es empleado público.

Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder sentirse productiva se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos días ya que tiene a su cargo a más vendedoras a quienes tiene que visitar para surtirlas de productos y también ella realizar sus propias ventas, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes y la bisutería.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal, es la tesorera del grupo y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy cumplidas.

Su sueño es llegar a  ser directora de Yanbal.
texts.en:
In the Olmedo canton in the Manabí province, every two weeks the Esfuerzo y Poder communal bnak meets. This place is known for its beautiful scenery and for its hardworking people who farm and raise animals.  

Here we meet Egda. She is 39 years old. She is married and has three children, aged 15, 13 and 7. The two oldest are in high school and the youngest is in elementary school. Her husband is a public employee. 

She is a housewife and to get her own income and feel productive she sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories).  She works every day and oversees more sellers whom she has to visit to supply them with products and also to do her own sales. She sells her products on credit and collects every week. She has been doing this activity for 4 years and it is going very well for her. What she sells the most are the perfume and jewelry.  

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and jewelry. This is her third cycle in the communal bank. She is the group treasurer and she likes it because the other members are very responsible.

Her dream is to become a director of Yanbal.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and jewelry.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Elsa has a repair shop that repairs any kind of shoes. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy materials needed for repairing shoes.

Elsa is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Elsa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for repairing shoes.

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is from Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years of age and single. She is in a retail business, operating a sari-sari store (or general store) to earn a living. She has been running her business for over one year and she operates her business proficiently — the primary return generated from her business is very excellent. 

Shirly made a choice to join GDMPC to have easy access to financial services. She applied for micro-credit intending to purchase grocery items to sell for her general store and for space rental. This is the first micro-credit she has taken out. Shirly hopes to make her business bigger to triple the return of her earnings for her future.

loans.use: to have additional capital to purchase grocery items.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.
 
Editha has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Editha is a new member of HSPFI. In the future,Editha hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Yessenia Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Yessenia , es habitante del municioio de Nindiri , junto a su familia , ella labora para una empresa privada , al igual que su esposo ; ellos luchan dia a dia para mejorar las condiciones de vida , la señora esta muy contenta por el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atravez de los fondos kiva , ya que con los prestamos obtenidos a logrado mejorar gran parte de la vivienda , la mayor dificultad que se le presento en este ciclo fue su embarazo , pero gracias a Dios esta mejor , Con este financimiento va a comprar materiales de construcción para terminar de cerrar un cuarto y espera que cuando termine de construir , le financien para montar su propio negocio y asi mejorar sus ingresos .
texts.en:
Yessenia lives with her family in the Nindiri municipality.  She works for a private company, just like her husband does.  They struggle day to day in order to improve their living conditions.

She is very happy to have the support of Afodenic through Kiva loans.  With the loans she has gotten she has managed to improve a large part of her house.  The greatest difficulty that presented itself in this cycle was her pregnancy.  She is better now, thank God.

She will use this loan to buy construction materials to finish enclosing a room.  She hopes that when she finishes building, she will get a loan to start her own business.  This will improve her income.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane, a 32-year-old married mother of four children, all of whom are in school, lives in Yeiei where she has been selling food for two years. Jane heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and is now requesting her second loan for 700 SDG in order to purchase maize and sugar to resell.  She will use the extra income arising from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase maize and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Nohemi

texts.es: Nohemi de 28 años de edad, convive con Frank de 29 años fruto de este amor nació July. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Periavente alta del distrito de Llochegua. Nohemi es una mujer trabajadora, ella se dedica al cultivo de piña, plátano y cacao en su parcela que esta ubicado en sumismo distrito. Al inicio trabajaba como peón junto a su esposo, fue que en ese entonces juntaron un capital con el que adquirieron una pequeña parcela con plantaciones de cacao, y poco a poco fueron expandiendo su cultivos hasta que en la actualidad producen una diversidad de frutas y cacao, del que ahora obtienen un ingreso económico mas rentable. En un futuro esta pensando abrir una tienda de venta de ropa, porque el trabajo en la agricultura es un poco pesado. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete por segunda vez en cancelar puntualmente en el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,500 nuevos soles realizará el mantenimiento de su parcela de piña, para ello contratará peones.
texts.en:
Nohemi, age 28, lives with 29 year old Frank.  They have one child, July.  They live together in their own house in the Periavente Alta community in the Llochegua district.  Nohemi is a hard-working woman.

She grows pineapples, bananas, and cacao on her parcel of land in the Llochegua district.  At first she worked with her husband as a day worker.  That is when they put together their money and got a small piece of land with cacao plants.  They were, little by little, expanding their crops, and they now produce a diversity of fruits and cacao from which they get a more profitable income.

In the future she is thinking of opening a clothing store because working in agriculture is somewhat tiring.

This will be her second loan with MFP.  She pledges, for the second time, to make her payments punctually.  She will use the 2,500 soles to hire day workers to perform maintenance on the land where she grows pineapples.

loans.use: to hire day workers.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence, a single lady of 24, has been operating a boutique shop in Kapsabet for two years, earning a monthly income of KES. 7,000. She is applying for her first loan of KES. 30,000 from KADET LTD. to purchase more new clothing to sell in her shop. With the goal of increasing her prosperity, Florence will reinvest her profits into the shop and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Maura Del Socorro

texts.es: El señora Maura, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, ella es una pqueña comerciante de cosmeticos desde hace varios años, ella es madre soltera, su hija mayor le apoya con los gastos del hogar, con los financimientos anteriore a logrado mejorar su vivienda en la parte delantera, esta vez va a invertir el credito en la comprar de materiales de construcción para la parte trasera  ya que esta  muy deteriorada ya que es de madera y zinc ; agradece el apoyo que le brina Afodenic atravez de kiva ya que con ese apoyo ayudan a mucha familias de escasos recursos para mejorar su condiciones de vida .
texts.en: Señora Maura lives in the city of Ticuantepe.  She has had a small business selling cosmetics for several years.  She is a single mother.  Her oldest daughter helps her with their home's expenses.  With her previous loans, she was able to improve the front part of her home.  This time, she is going to invest her loan in the purchase of construction materials for the back part since it is very deteriorated since is is made of wood and metal.  She is thankful for the support that Afodenic is offering her through Kiva.  With this support, they help many families with scarce resources to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man, aged 47 years, who has six school-going children. His spouse is Ruth, a business lady selling vegetables and fruits. James has been a livestock trader for a period of ten years. He earns a monthly income of KES 40,000.

James is applying for a loan of KES 100,000 and wishes to use the amount to purchase livestock for trading. (KES 95,000 plus transport costs of KES 5,000) This is his fourth term loan from KADET LTD. The profit amount will be used to educate his children.

He hopes to prosper in business and live a happy life.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for resale.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.
 
Epifania has a vegetable garden from which she sells vegetables like string beans and eggplants. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers for the vegetable garden.

Epifania has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Epifania hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the vegetable garden.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria works hard to support her family. Maria is married and has a food and vegetables vending business in the Philippines.

Maria has requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock and ingredients for her business.

Maria has been in this business for 30 years now.

In the future, Maria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock and ingredients for her business

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl de 66 años de edad, está casado con Benjamina de 46 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 4 hijos con los que viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Periavente alta del distrito de Llochegua. Raúl es un hombre trabajador que día a día labra la tierra con el único fin de mantener a su querida familia, él se dedica al cultivo de café y cacao en su parcela propia. Generalmente trabaja con la ayuda de su querida esposa e hijos pero en los días de cosecha siempre cuenta con el apoyo de peones quienes le facilitaron en la extracción de frutos, para después expenderlo en el mercado de su ciudad. Nos comenta que antes de dedicarse a la agricultura él trabajaba como carpintero en una fabrica de muebles en la ciudad de lima, pues al ver que la situación volvió para continuar con el legado de sus padres, que es la agricultura. Ahora está contento con esta labor que realiza, pues gracias al fruto que produce obtiene un ingreso económico rentable. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar el puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles cancelará a sus peones por haber realizado la limpieza de la malezas de su campo agrícola. Raúl está feliz con su banco comunal por que son buenos y comprometidos en el trabajo que realizan. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles contratará peones para que hagan la limpieza de su campo agrícola.
texts.en:
Raúl is 66 years old and is married to 46 year old Benjamina.  Together they have four children who live with them in their home, located in Periavente, within the Llochegua district.  Raúl is a hard working man who works the land every day with the only aim of supporting his loving family.  He raises coffee and cacao on his own parcel, and generally works with the help of his loving wife and children, but during the harvest season, he must hire field hands to help him with the collection and transportation to market in town.

He says that he worked as a carpenter in a furniture factory in Lima before becoming a farmer, but he decided to return to his parents’ legacy of farming.  How he can count on this labor, which thankfully is profitable.

This will be his second loan through MFP and he is committed to paying it off on time.  He will use the 1,000 PEN to pay field hands to clear the weeds off of his farmland.  Raúl is happy with his communal bank because the members are good and committed to their work.

loans.use: to hire field hands.

loans.name: Zhanna

texts.en:
Zhanna, who lives in Vanadzor, is 47 years old. She is married and has a daughter and a son. Also with them lives Zhanna’s father-in-law who is a retiree. Both Zhanna’s children are studying at the teachers' training institute. From their earliest years they dreamed of being teachers, as their father is. 
Zhanna is an economist and she runs her own business.  She sells underclothes in a rented shop. She buys merchandise  from neighbor countries and from Yerevan as well. 
Zhanna says that her business allows her to solve the major part of her family’s needs and also to pay for her children's education. 
Zhanna needs a 700.000 AMD loan to buy new underclothes for her business.

loans.use: to buy new underclothes for her business

loans.name: Sou

texts.en:
Sou is from Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She is fifty-nine years old and is married with five children, two of whom are single and assist her in crop farming business. She usually grows a few types of crops like rice, corn and beans. In addition to this, she operates a business selling fresh fish and also takes some time at home to raise some pigs. She is very hard-working in her daily activities.

For her fourth cycle loan from HKL, she would like to purchase soy bean seeds and ten sacks of fertilizers for rice and bean crops. She hopes to improve her business someday with the constant support from our lenders.

loans.use: to purchase soy bean seeds and 10 sacks of fertilizers for rice and bean crops.

loans.name: Roses

texts.en:
Roses is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an ambulant banana-vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of bananas for her business.

Roses has been in this business for ten years. Roses earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Roses has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es:
Ronald de 23 años de edad, convive con Ruth de 19 años, fruto de este amor nació Milena. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Periavente alta del distrito de Llochegua. Ronald es un joven de buenos principios dedicado a la agricultura, dejó los estudios por falta de apoyo económico, es así que se dedico a la agricultura, cultivando cacao y café. Poco tiempo después tuvo su pareja, que fruto de esta relación nació Milena, por la que Ronald debe de sacrificarse aún más. En la actualidad trabaja cultivando café y cacao juntamente con su querida esposa, pero en los dias de cosecha siempre cuenta con peones quienes le facilitan en la extracción de los frutos.
Ronald está feliz con su trabajo por que le es muy rentable.
Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete una vez más en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. El esta conforme con el trabajo que realiza su banco comunal. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles realizara la limpieza de su campo agrícola de café, para ello contratará peones.
texts.en:
Ronald is 23 years old. He lives with Ruth who is 19 years old, and through their love Milena was born. They live in their own house located in the community of Periavente in the upper part of the district of Llochegua. Ronald is a youth with good principals who works in agriculture. 

He left his studies due to the lack of economical support, and thus he works in agriculture, growing cocoa and coffee. A short time later he formed a relationship and from the fruit of this relationship was born Milena, for which Ronald made more sacrifices. 

Currently he works growing coffee and cocoa together with his dear wife, but during the days of harvest he always has laborers who help, making the harvesting easier. Ronald is happy with his works because it is very profitable.

This is his first loan through MFP, and one more thing is that he promises to make his payments on time, working accordingly with his communal bank. He will use the 2,000 soles to contract laborers for the clearing of the coffee fields.

loans.use: to contract laborers

loans.name: Simion

texts.en:
Simion is a twenty-one-year-old married man. He has a child. He describes himself as a risk-taker. He operates a retail business where he sells electronics. He has been involved in this business for three years. 

Simion's business is located in a strategic area and his primary customers are walk-ins. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds to improve his business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase torches and woofers. His business goal is to run a wholesale shop within five years.

loans.use: to buy more torches and woofers to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is from Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is forty-two years old, married, and blessed with two children. Her husband is an overseas Filipino worker (OFW). She is in the agriculture business. She has been engaged in this business for about five years and happily the income generated is quite good so she is able to sustain the family's needs and pay for the education of her children who are in the elementary grade. 

The micro-credit loan that she has applied for will be used to purchase feed for her pigs. The financial gain is very helpful to the family in order to improve the farm they are cultivating. Vilma plans in the future to reinvest the income generated to make her business bigger.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Gina is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food-vending business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Marivic has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stock of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Marivic has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Marivic hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for sale

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses has 4 years experience in the farming business with vegetables and onions being his specialties in his rural home area of Kitale, Western Kenya. He is 33 and married with 3 children from 15 to 9 years of age. He works as a carpenter besides farming.
Moses has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to  buy and insure a dairy cow. He says he wants to use the income to put up a carpentry workshop for additional income which will help him in educating his children and ensuring the family's financial security.

Moses worries about the challenges of price fluctuations in the markets and diseases which can be great setbacks to farmers' anticipated income.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina lives in Yei. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for two years. She is forty years old, married, and has four children. All of them are still in school. 

Regina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of SDG 500 in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Roque

texts.es:
Roque, de 33 años de edad casado con Margarita de 28 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 1 hijo, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Periavente alta del distrito de Llochegua.
Roque es un hombre dedicado a la agricultura,  desde muy pequeño le ha encantado el trabajo en el campo, él cultiva café en su parcela ubicado en su mismo distrito. Dice que para tener un buen rendimiento en la producción del café es necesario tener en cuenta la selección de semilla, luego su trasplante y el mantenimiento adecuado hasta el secado de los granos de café para de esta manera obtener un fin económico rentable.
Habitualmente roque trabaja solo pero en temporada de cosecha siempre requiere de peones quienes le facilitan en la recolección de los granos de café. Él en un futuro está pensando comprar más terrenos agrícolas para expandir sus plantaciones. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el apago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles realizará el mantenimiento de su campo agrícola, para ello contratará peones.
texts.en:
Roque, age 33, is married to 28 year old Margarita, and they have one child.  They live in their own house in the Periavente Alta community in the Llochegua district.

Roque is a farmer.  Ever since he was very young he has loved working in the field.  He grows coffee on his plot of land in the Llochegua district.  He says that in order to have a good yield of coffee production you need to keep in mind the selection of the seed, their transplantation, and adequate maintenance until the drying of the coffee beans.  This is the way to a profitable financial end.

Roque usually works alone, but during the harvest season he always needs day laborers to facilitate the gathering of the coffee beans.  In the future he is thinking of buying more farmland in order to expand his fields.

This is his first loan with MFP.  He pledges to make his payments on time.  He will use the 2,000 soles to hire day laborers to perform maintenance on his fields.

loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a resident and a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. He is aged twenty-seven and is married with two children aged six and one. He carries out farming in his rural home where he lives with his family and produces mainly maize, vegetables and milk for the local market. He is employed as a driver.

Peter has requested a loan of 101,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable him to expand his dairy farming and venture into poultry farming. He says he will buy and insure a dairy cow at 41,600 KES, buy poultry birds at 20,000 KES and build a housing unit for the birds with the remaining 40,000 KES. He is glad Juhudi Kilimo loans gave him access to farming which he says earns him better income than his employment.

He however mentions unreliability of rains, fluctuations in market prices and animal diseases as the real challenges in farming especially for the dairy business.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow and poultry birds.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish vending business.

Hazel has been in this business for four years and earns additional income from raising livestock.

Hazel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business so as to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor de 45 años de edad casado con Maura de 40 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 2 hermosas criatura con los que viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Periavente alta del distrito de Llochegua 
Bondadoso, noble y trabajador a si es víctor en la comunidad donde vive, él se dedica a la agricultura cultivando cacao, café, plátano y algunos frutos cítricos juntamente con su adorada esposa y sus hijos.
Cuenta él que se inicio en esta actividad desde muy pequeño, y con la ayuda de sus padres poco a poco fue asimilando del control y manejo de los cultivos. Ahora víctor está orgulloso y agradecido de sus padres por todas las enseñanzas y el gran legado que le dejó. Como en todo trabajo es necesario estar constantemente con el único fin de lograr una buena producción. En un futuro víctor esta pensando llevar sus frutales hacia la ciudad de Huanta para comercializarla y de esa manera obtener mejores ingresos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Víctor está contento con su banco comunal por que son solidarios. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles realizará el mantenimiento de su cultivo de plátano, para ello contratará peones.
texts.en:
Victor, who is 45, is married to Maura, who is 40.  Together they have two beautiful children with whom they live in their own home in the community of Periavente Alta in the district of Llochegua.

Kind, noble, and hardworking are words that describe Victor.  In the community where he lives, he practices agriculture for a living, growing cacao, coffee, bananas, and some citrus fruits together with his beloved wife and children.

He tells us that he started this work when he was very young and that, with the help of his parents, little by little he took over management of the crops.  Victor is now proud of and thankful for his parents for all the teachings and the great legacy they left him.  As with all work, it's necessary to constantly be focused solely on achieving good production.  In the future, Victor is thinking about taking his fruits to the city of Huanta to sell them and thus earn more money.  This is his second loan with MFP and he promises to make his payments on time.  Victor is happy with his communal bank because its members are supportive.  With the 1,000 nuevos soles, he will care for his banana crop, for which he will hire laborers.

loans.use: to hire laborers

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Yei. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for two years. She is thirty-two years old, married, and has four children. All of them are still in school. 

Betty heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income she generates from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita is fifty-six years old and married with nine children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Bernardita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm equipment.

Bernardita has been farming rice for eighteen years and also earns additional income from buying and selling cosmetics.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm equipment.

loans.name: Cosmas

texts.en:
Cosmas is the father of six children aged between sixteen and three. He is aged thirty-nine and has been in the farming business for fifteen years. He says income from farming meets the major part of his family's needs.

Cosmas has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He had previously taken a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo and says the skills he has so far gave him the motivation to do farming in a bigger and better way. He intends to buy a dairy cow of a better grade in order to improve his output per dairy cow.

He too laments of high costs of production and low rains which makes feeding costly during off seasons.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gawdensia

texts.en:
Gawdensia has operated her clothing business in Nakuru town for the last twelve years. She is forty-three years old, married to John and they have one school-going child.

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our existing clients and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more clothes to add to her business.

In the future, Gawdensia hopes to expand her business and open a boutique.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria de 50 años de edad convive con Mauro de 37 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 3 hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Periavente alta del Llochegua. Victoria, es una mujer talentosa y hacendosa en su hogar, ella se dedica a la agricultura exactamente al cultivo de cacao, café y cítricos ya hace 35 años.
Cuenta que su esposo es maestro albañil, mientras que ella se encarga de los quehaceres de la casa y de sus parcelas agrícolas. Generalmente trabaja con su esposo pero en temporadas de cosecha siempre cuenta con el apoyo de peones  que le puedan facilitar en la cosecha, para luego expenderlo en el mercado del distrito de Llochegua. Ella esta contenta con esta labor que realiza por que gracias a esto puede tener un ingreso económico familiar. En un futuro esta pensando comprarse un lote de terreno para construirlo como vivienda, cerca de la ciudad y con el tiempo puedan habitar sus hijos para que estudien. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete esta vez más en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,500 invertirá en la compra de un lote de vivienda.
texts.en:
Victoria is 50 years old and has lived with Mauro for 37 years and from this relationship she has three children. They live in their own home located in the community of Periavente Alta in Llochegua. Victoria is a talented and industrious woman in her home. She works in agriculture, that is to say growing cocoa, coffee, and citrus for 35 years. Her husband is a master mason, while she is in charge of the household chores and their agricultural land. 

She usually works with her husband but in harvesting time they always have the help of laborers in order to make harvesting easier, so that later they can sell it in the market in the district of Llochegua. She is happy with this work that she does because thanks to this she can have a family income. She is thinking of buying a plot of land to build housing near the city so that in the future, eventually, she can live there with her children so they can study. This is her second loan through MFP, and she promises once again to make her payments punctually. She will invest the 2,500 soles in the purchase of a plot for housing.

loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустам 40 - летний женатый мужчина. У него четверо детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он занимается животноводством. В основном он откармливает и продает скот. Этим видом деятельности занимается шесть лет. Кредит берет для закупа коровы и бычков.
texts.en: Rustam is 40 years old, married, and has four children. His wife is a homemaker. He is involved in animal husbandry; he raises and sells livestock. He has been doing this type of work for six years. He is asking for a loan to purchase a cow and some bulls.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and some bulls.

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.ru: Фирдавс проживает в районе Хуросон. Он занимается торговлей. Ему 22 года. Он рядом с домом открыл ларек, где продает продукты питания. Этим видом бизнеса он занимается два года. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота и расширения своей деятельности.
texts.en: Firdavs lives in the Xuroson district. He is 22 years old, and is involved in sales. He opened a shop next to his house where he sells groceries. He has been involved in this type of business for two years. He is asking for a loan to increase his product turnover and expand his business.

loans.use: to increase his product turnover and expand his business.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 29,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more ingredients for her food vending business.

Flora has been in this business for 11 years. Flora earns more income from rice retailing.

Flora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry birds and build a poultry housing unit.

loans.name: Khaticha

texts.ru: Хатича проживает в районе Яван. Ей 35 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Она вместе с мужем занимается торговлей игрушек и детской одежды. Она арендует торговую точку рядом с магазинами на рынке. Торговлей Хатича занимается два года. До этого она работала по профессии, бухгалтером. Она берет кредит для покупки игрушек, чтобы увеличить ассортимент товара.
texts.en: Khaticha lives in the Yavan district. She is 35 years old, married, and has two children. She and her husband sell toys and children's clothing. She rents a  stall at the market. Khaticha has been involved in sales for two years. Previously she worked in her trained profession as a bookkeeper. She is asking for a loan to purchase toys in order to increase her assortment of merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase toys

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn works hard to support her family. Genelyn is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Genelyn requested a 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Genelyn has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Genelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Segundina

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of six children, Segundina works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Segundina is borrowing 16,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her tailoring business.

Segundina has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 45 años de edad, es viuda, pero tiene 3 hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Llochegua. Victoria, es una mujer trabajadora que sufrió mucho por la perdida irreparable de su querido esposo quien era su apoyo y compañero de toda la vida. A pesar de ello victoria supo salir adelante por sus tres  hijos que tiene. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el distrito de Llochegua, cuenta que al inicio solo expendía verduras, pero sus clientes requerían más frutas por lo que empezó con el expendio de éste producto. Ella está contenta con su negocio por que hasta el momento todo le va muy bien, mas adelante esta pensando en comprarse un terreno en la provincia de Huanta con la finalidad de que sus hijos puedan estudiar en un mejor colegio y vivir en ella. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, incrementara más productos para el expendio en su tienda.
texts.en:
Victoria is 45 years old, a widow, but has 3 children. They live together in her own house located in the district of Llochegua. Victoria is a working woman who suffered a lot through the irreparable loss of her dear husband who was her support and lifelong companion. Despite this, Victoria knew how to get ahead to bring up her children. 

She works selling fruits and vegetables in the district of Llochegua. In the beginning she only sold vegetables, but her customers wanted more fruit so she began to sell this product. She is happy with her business which has been going very well.  Further on she is thinking of buying land in the province of Huanta with the result that her children can study in a better school and live there. This is her second loan through MFP, and she promises to make her payments on time. With the 1,500 soles she will add more products to sell in her store.

loans.use: to buy more products and fruit in order to sell them in her store

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter de 36 años de edad, está casado con victoria de 38 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 3 hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicado en la comunidad de Periavente  Alta del distrito de Llochegua. Walter es un hombre entusiasta y emprendedor, quien se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en la comunidad de Periavente alta. En este negocio ya lleva como 10 años por lo que tiene experiencia y decisión bien centrada. También se dedica a la agricultura donde cultiva café, cacao y cítricos. Nos comenta que mientras se dedica a la agricultura su querida esposa es quien se queda a cargo de su tienda, pero en los días de cosecha ambos están juntos realizando los trabajos porque requiere de una buena cantidad de personas quienes les puedan agilizar la cosecha. Walter esta orgulloso por lo que hasta el momento viene logrando buenos resultados, tanto en la agricultura como en la venta de abarrotes. En un futuro Walter desea comprarse una vivienda en su distrito donde piensa abrir un restaurante. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas.
Walter está conforme con el trabajo de su banco comunal. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles realizará la compra de más productos para el expendio en su tienda.
texts.en:
Walter, who is 36 years old, is married to Victoria, who is 38, and they have three children. They live together in their own house located in the community of Periavente Alta in the district of Llochegua. Walter is an enthusiastic and entrepreneurial man who sells groceries in the community of Periavente Alta. He has been in this business for about 10 years, so he has experience and well-focused determination. He also works in agriculture, growing coffee, cacao, and citrus fruits. He tells us that while he works in agriculture, his beloved wife is the one who takes charge of their store, but during harvest time they both are doing this work because it requires a good number of people who can speed up the harvest for them. Walter is proud because up to now he has achieved good results, in agriculture as much as in the sale of groceries. In the future, Walter wants to buy a house in his district where he is thinking of opening a restaurant. This is his second loan with MFP, so he promises to make his payments punctually. 

Walter is in agreement with the work of his communal bank. With the 1500 PEN, he will buy more products to sell in his store.

loans.use: to buy more products to stock his store

loans.name: Wuilliam

texts.es: Wuilliam de 30 años de edad convive con florentina de 28 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 2 hermosas hiajs; ellos viven en su casa propia ubicado en la comunidad de Periavente alta del distrito de Llochegua. Wuillian es un joven emprendedor de buenos principios, él se dedica al cultivo de cacao y café juntamente con su querida esposa. Nos comenta que en un inicio, hace mas de 15 años, la población de esta parte del Perú atravesaban momentos criticos pero lo unico que les quedaba era su actividad agrícola, no se detuvieron. Hoy tiene extensos cultivos de café, su producto que tiene mucha demanda en su país. En un futuro, desea abrir una tienda de venta de agroquímicos, pues sabe que así obtendrá más ingresos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete una vez mas en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3, 000 nuevos soles realizará el mantenimiento de su campo agrícola, para ello debe contratar peones.
texts.en:
Wuilliam, 30, lives with Florentina, 28, and they have two pretty daughters from this relationship.  They live in their own house located in the community of Periavente Alta in the district of Llochegua.

Wuilliam is an enterprising young man of good principles.  He works growing cacao and coffee together with his beloved wife.  He tells us that in the beginning, more than 15 years ago, the people in this part of Peru were going through difficult times, but the only thing they had was their agricultural work.  They did not stop.  Today he has extensive coffee crops, his product that is in great demand in his country.  In the future he wants to open a store to sell agrochemicals because he knows that in that way he will get more income.

This is his second loan with MFP, for which he promises once again to make his payments punctually.

With the 3,000 PEN he will do maintenance on his farmland, for which he needs to hire farmworkers.

loans.use: to hire farmworkers.

loans.name: Ekitua

texts.en:
Ekitui, a 46-year-old married father blessed with four children aged 10, 5, 3 and 2 years, is a poultry farmer and sells maize as well. He started these businesses six years ago and earns a monthly income of KES.15,000.

Ektui is requesting his first loan of KES 20,000 to purchase chicks to rear and later sell at a profit. He will reinvest his profit in his business. Ektui dreams of buying more land, continuing with his businesses, and educating his children.

loans.use: to purchase chicks to rear and later sell at a profit.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Yei. She sells food from a stall and has been in the business for two years. She is 40 year old, married and has no child.  

Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from the BRAC credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 in order to purchase tomatoes and beans.  She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and beans for sale.

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.es:
Zenobia de 46 años de edad, casado con Sergio, fruto de este amor nacieron 4 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicado en la comunidad de Periavente alta del distrito de Llochegua.  Zenobia es una señora  muy talentosa  en los quehaceres de la casa, así como en el trabajo, pues se dedica al cultivo café en su parcela ubicada a una hora de su casa. Nos comenta que asimismo que para avanzar en sus trabajos se va a vivir a su parcela agrícola juntamente con toda su familia, por que es cansado estar subiendo todos los días. Es por ello que los domingos hace compras para la semana y enrrumba al trabajo los lunes en la madrugada para luego después de la faena volver a casa los sábados en la tarde. De esta manera Zenobia trabaja con el único fin de salir adelante. Ella en un futuro próximo desea  abrir una tienda de abarrotes pero aún su vivienda no esta tan amoblada, por tal motivo desea poner el piso de su vivienda.
Ella está feliz con esta labor que tiene por que hasta el momento todo le va muy bien. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas.
Con los 1500 nuevos soles invertirá en el sembrío de más cultivos de café, para ello comprar semillas y abono.
texts.en:
Zenobia is 46 years old and is married to Sergio. They have four children. They live in their own house located in the community of Periavente Alta, in the district of Llochegua. Zenobia is a woman who is very talented in household duties as well as in work, where she grows coffee on her parcel of land located an hour from her house. She tells us furthermore that to advance in her work she goes to live on her agricultural parcel with all her family, because it is tiring to go up there every day. For this reason, she does her shopping on Sundays for the week, and then she heads to work early in the morning on Mondays, then returning to her house on Saturday afternoons after work. In this way Zenobia works with the sole goal of advancing. In the near future she wants to open a grocery store, but her house is still not furnished. For that reason, she wants to put a floor in her house.

She is happy with the work that she does, because up to now it has gone very well for her. This is her second loan with MFP, so she promises to make her payments punctually. 

With the 1500 PEN, she will invest in the planting of more fields of coffee, and for that she will buy seeds and compost.

loans.use: to buy coffee seeds and compost

loans.name: Marlene Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 32 años, es una mujer muy amable y luchadora, madre de una pequeña de 4 años, a la cual saca adelante sola ya que por diversos motivos es madre soltera, vive en lo que anteriormente era casa de sus padres, ya que hace pocos meses que su madre falleció y su padre nunca vivió con ella ya que la abandono cuando era pequeña, por ello desde pequeña ha sabido lo que es salir adelante con sacrificio y mas aun cuando se lleva una pena tan grande como es el perder a nuestra madre, a la cual esta muy agradecida porque siempre la apoyo y le dio su amor, pero a pesar de lo sucedido sigue luchando ya que tiene a su pequeña que es lo más grande que le ha regalado Dios, nos comenta Isabel, a pesar de todo lo que pueda pasar con solo mirar a su hija puede levantarse y seguir adelante.

Isabel anteriormente trabajaba en el campo, ahorro poco a poco y decidió tener su negocio de venta de camote, en el cual trabaja actualmente desde hace ya 1 año, con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo pudo alquilar un local donde ahora vende camotes por sacos, a la semana puede vender hasta 25 sacos, siendo los días lunes y viernes donde mas vende, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque atiende bien a los clientes pero lo mas importante porque agradece a Dios ya que él es quien guía sus pasos y sobre todo porque tiene que hacer bien las cosas para que su hija se sienta orgullosa de ella.

Isabel está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería (camotes) en el campo ya que tiene menos precio, lo que le permitirá tener más variedad de productos y poder aumentar sus ingresos, para así seguir luchando y poder cumplir su gran sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hija y tener un local propio para su negocio”.
texts.en:
Isabel is 32 years old. She is a friendly and struggling woman, and mother of a four year old, which she is bringing up alone because for various reasons she is a single mother. She lives in what was formerly her parents’ house. It has been some months since her mother died and her father never lived with her as he abandoned them when she was young, and because of this, since she was young, she has known what it is to make sacrifices, even that of carrying a pain so great as when we lose our mother, to whom she is very grateful because she always supported her and gave her love. Despite what happened she continues fighting as she has her little one that is the greatest gift that God has given her, Isabel says, and despite everything that might happen by looking at her daughter she is able to get up and keep going.

Isabel previously worked in the fields, saving little by little and she decided to open a business selling sweet potatoes, and she has been working at this for one year. With work and effort she was able to rent a small place where now she sells bags of sweet potatoes, selling up to 25 bags of sweet potatoes weekly, selling more Monday and Fridays. She thinks that she is doing well in her business because she serves her clients well, but what is more important she thanks God who guides her steps, especially because she has to do things well so that her daughter will be proud of her.

Isabel is very grateful for the Kiva loans and thanks to the help that has been given she could buy merchandise (sweet potatoes) in the field as they cost less, which allows her a greater variety of products and to be able to add to her income, to continue fighting and be able to fulfill her big dream of “providing a profession for her daughter and having her own facility for her business.”

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
Benjamin tiene 30años y vive en la ciudad de imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por la importante actividad comercial de sus habitantes. En sus alrededores se encuentra la Fortaleza de Ungará, último vestigio de la Cultura Huarco, antiguo Cañete. También se hallan antiguas haciendas instaladas entre las extensas áreas de cultivo, es padre de 2 pequeños a los cuales adora mucho, asimismo ama mucho a su esposa y sobre todo la considera como su mano derecha ya que siempre esta a su lado en las buenas y en las malas y sobre todo porque siempre lo aconseja.

Benjamín trabaja manejando una mototaxi pero tambien se dedica al negocio que tiene con su esposa que es la de venta de cuyes (el cuy es una especie de conejillo originarios de nuestro Pais Peru), desde hace 2 años, el nos comenta que cuando estos animalitos estan pequeños el se encariña tanto que cuando los vende le da pena que se los lleven, el cree que le va bien en el negocio porque cría a los animalitos con mucha  higiene y los clientes se sientes seguros por ello.

Actualmente Benjamín está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda el podrá comprar más cuyes en especial si son hembras, ya que estos animalitos se reproducen rápido y le permitiría tener más cuyes para vender,con ello podra aumentar sus ingresos y poder seguir ahorrando y seguir luchando para cumplir su gran sueño:” Terminar de Construir su casa”.
texts.en:
Benjamin is 30 years old and lives in the city of Imperial, a city characterized by the important commercial activity of its inhabitants. Ungara Fortress is in the vicinity, the last vestige of the Huarco culture of ancient Cañete. One also sees old farm houses interspersed among extensive areas of cultivation.

Benjamin is the father of two small ones whom he greatly adores. He also loves his wife very much and considers her his right hand since she is always by his side in the good and the bad and above all because she is always giving him advice.

Benjamin drives a motor taxi but he also has had a business with his wife for two years selling guinea pigs (the guinea pig is a specie of small rabbit that is native to Peru). He notes that when these small animals are young, he becomes so fond of them that he feels bad when they are taken off. He believes that the business is going well because he is raising the small animals following hygienic standards and his customers feel assured by that.

Currently Benjamin is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, he will be able to purchase guinea pigs, especially females. Since these little animals reproduce rapidly this will enable him to have more to sell. Consequently he will be able to increase his income and continue saving and fighting to realize his great dream: to finish building his house.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 39 years old.  She is married and has 3 children.  Merly works hard to provide for her family. She sells dried cassava in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Merly has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been selling dried cassava for 11 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.  Merly aspires to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
El señor Edgar es de la ciudad de Pilar, es una persona  muy trabajadora y emprendedora y con buena moral de pago, es su segunda operación con la Fundación Paraguaya.
Edgar, es propietario de una despensa, y nos comenta que se dedica a esta actividad hace más de 8 años. Gracias al tiempo que lleva en esto ya tiene una clientela bien formada, lo cual le ha ayudado a mantener a su familia y darle todo lo que ellos necesitan para una mejor vida, sin privaciones.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, comestibles, lácteos y demás artículos de primera necesidad, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y tener en stock mercaderías para poder ofrecer a sus clientes. Agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
Edgar is from the city of Pilar. He is a very hard-working and enterprising person, and good with his payments. This is his second loan from Fundación Paraguaya. 

Edgar owns a small grocery store, and says that he has been doing this for more than eight years. Thanks to the time he has been in this business, he already has a well-established clientele; which has helped him support his family, and give them everything they need for a better life without hardships.

He is applying for the loan to buy drinks, food products, dairy products, and other basic household items with which he will be able to stock his store and have merchandise to offer his customers. He is grateful to he Foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity he is receiving.

loans.use: To buy drinks, food products, dairy products, and other basic household items.

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es:
La Señora Lucinda es de la ciudad de Encanacion, ella es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de todo tipos de ropas es vendedora independiente.
Comenta que gracias al carisma que tiene ha podido tener éxito en sus negocios e ir progresando. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora, luchadora y por sobre todo honesta, que busca poder crecer como empresaria y también como persona. Su meta es poder tener un gran negocio donde vender sus productos.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder invertirlo en prendas de todo tipo., ya que siempre quiere estar abastecida ente los pedidos de sus clientes. Ella está agradecida con la fundación y con kiva por la oportunidad que estas le dan.
texts.en:
Lucinda is from the city of Encarnacion.  She has a retail business selling all types of clothing, and she works as an independent vendor.  She comments that thanks to her charisma, she has been able to have success in her business and continue to make progress.  She describes herself as a very tenacious and hardworking woman, who above all, is honest.  She is seeking to grow as a businesswoman and as a person.  Her goal is to have a big store where she could sell her products.

She is requesting a loan to invest in all types of garments, because she always wants to be well-stocked when she receives orders from her customers. She is very grateful to the Fundacion and to Kiva for providing her with this opportunity.

loans.use: to guy garments to later sell

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.es:
La señora Leoncia tiene 76 años de edad, es separada desde   hace 37 años, de su relación tuvo cinco hijos de los cuales, quienes ya son todos mayores e independientes.
Comenta que tiene una despensa que mantiene funcionando desde hace 37 años, fue un emprendimiento de la sra. Leoncia para generar ingresos económicos para su familia y así costear los gastos varios que se generaban,  gracias  a eso pudo llevar su familia porque es una señora luchadora, trabajadora  y siempre predispuesta al trabajo sin importarle la edad que tiene.
Solicita este préstamo para la compra de maíz, afrecho, almidón, bebidas en general, gaseosas, golosinas, carbón, pollos, cerdos, yerba, azúcar y otros artículos que le permitirá ofrecer  a sus clientes y poder mejorar su ingreso mensual.-
texts.en:
Leoncia, 76, has been separated for 37 years.  From this relationship she had five children who are already adults and independent.

She says she has a store she has maintained for 37 years.  It was Leoncia's enterprise to generate income for her family and so pay for the various expenses she had.  Thanks to this she managed to support her family, because she is a hardworking woman and a fighter, always willing to work without regard for how old she is.

She is requesting this loan to buy corn, bran, starch, drinks in general, soda, lollipops, charcoal, chicken, pork, herbs, sugar, and other items that she will offer her customers and be able to improve her monthly income.

loans.use: to buy basic household necessities to sell.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es: Joel de 25 años de edad, convive con Milka de 21 años, fruto de este gran amor necio Joseph de 3 años, ellos viven en la comunidad de Periavente alta del distrito de Llochegua. Joel, es un joven creativo y perseverante, él se dedica al cultivo de cacao, café y furtas cítricas. En un principio no todo era tan fácil pues ellos tenían que sacrificarse por que no contaban con ningún ingreso, pues lo poco que tenían los invertían en la mejora de su parcela y su alimentación, fue así que supo salir adelante. Joel está feliz con el trabajo que realiza por que le genera una buena rentabilidad, así podrá asegurar el bienestar de su familia. Joel más adelante quiere abrir una tienda de zapatos por que vio una buena oportunidad a éste negocio, y no hay negocio alguno dentro de su distrito. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles invertirá en el mantenimiento de su parcela de cacao, para ello contratará peones.
texts.en:
Joel is 25 years old and lives with Milka who is 21. The fruit of this great love is Joseph, 3 years old. They live in the community of Periavente Alta in Llochegua district. Joel is a creative and persevering young man dedicated to cultivating cacao, coffee, and citrus fruit. In the beginning things weren't so easy; they had to make sacrifices because they couldn't count on any income. The little they had was invested in improving their parcel of land and in feeding themselves. In this manner they learned how to get ahead. 

Joel is happy with his work since it generates a good profit, sufficient to assure the wellbeing of his family. In the near future, Joel wants to open a shoe store, as he sees a good future in this business. There are no businesses within his district. 

This is his 1st loan through MFP and he is committed to making his payments punctually. With the 1,000 new sols, he will contract day laborers to perform maintenance on his cacao parcel.

loans.use: to contract day laborers to perform maintenance on his cacao parcel.

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: Ros, age 41, is a loving mother who always looks after her 3 school-age kids and all household things in a well-managed way. The main source of income is from her husband who owns a small coffee shop located in Dongkor commune. From this type of business, he is able to earn around $9.20 per day. Ros tells us that their business is improving and there are many customers who prefer to drink coffee there.  She needs some funds from Kiva to pay to decorate her cafe in order to attract more clients. With the rest of the loan, she will begin to fix her house. In the future, Ros intends to enlarge her coffee shop and decorate it more impressively.

loans.use: to pay to decorate her cafe in order to attract more customers.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia works hard to support her family. Rosalia is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

Rosalia requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net and materials for the repair of her fishing boat. Rosalia has been in this business for 6 years now.  In the future, Rosalia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy an additional fishing net and materials for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is 56 years old.  She is married and has 7 children.  She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Myrna is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.  Myrna has been farming rice for 20 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit was born in Yerevan in 1960.  She is divorced and lives with her son, daughter, daughter-in-law and grandchild. Anahit graduated from Armenian Economic University and she has a bachelors degree in the field of economics-cybernetics.  Anahit used to work as an economist and as an accountant in different companies and in the Armenian government, as well.  Her salary was not enough to take care of her family, and it was very hard for her to raise her children alone, so she decided to run her own business.

For more than 7 years, Anahit and her son have been engaged in fruit and vegetable trading. Her relatives allow Anahit to use their shop space in Yerevan  free of charge and this helps her to keep her expenses down.  Anahit’s son buys fruits and vegetables from wholesale markets and the nearest villages and transports them to the business place early every morning.  Anahit says that trading is hard work for women, but it is more profitable than her previous occupations and she is very appreciative of her business.  Anahit is renting a second shop in Yerevan and wants to develop their family business. So she asks for a 1,700 USD loan to buy an assortment of fruits and vegetables for her second shop.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of fruits and vegetables for her second shop

loans.name: Nicholus

texts.en:
Nicholas is 27 years old.  He is married and blessed with a two year-old child. He sells utensils, a business he started six years ago. His monthly income is KES.15,000. He wants to purchase cups, plates, sufurias and water jugs for sale, and therefore has requested a loan of KES.30,000. 

The profit he makes from his business would help him open a business for his wife. His dream is to become stable in his business and educate his children. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase cups, plates, sufurias (pots) and water jugs

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 54 years old.  She is married and has 3 children. Victoria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Victoria has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 23 years and also earns an income from pig fattening. Victoria aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Salmi

texts.es:
La Sra Salmi  tiene 44 años y se dedica a la compra y venta de carne, fruta y verduras. Tiene 5 hijos de los cuales una está trabajando en la Argentina, además de su actividad se dedica tambien a criar chanchos para luego venderlo a buen precio.
Ella manifiesta que le deja buenas ganancia todo el trabajo que ella hace, pues pudimos notar que ella es una mujer muy trabajadora. Anteriormente trabajaba como empleada domestica, y tuvo que dejarlo para cuidar a sus hijos y fue así que empezó su pequeño negocio. Ella junto a su marido se encargan de mantener la casa y solventar el día a día.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de 3 chanchos ya que llega todo la semana santa y quiere poder tenerlos para criarlos y luego venderlo.
texts.en:
Sra. Salmi is 44 years old and buys and sells meat, fruit and vegetables. She has five children, one of whom is working in Argentina. In addition to this business, she also raises pigs to sell at a good price.

She notes that both of her businesses provides a good income because she is a very hardworking woman. Formerly she used to work as a domestic employee but had to stop in order to care for her children and that was how she started her small businesses. She and her husband together maintain the household and pay the day-to-day expenses.

She is requesting this loan to purchase three pigs so that when Easter comes around she will have been able to have them to raise and sell.

loans.use: to purchase 3 cows to raise and later sell.

loans.name: Ma. Wenilyn

texts.en:
Ma. Wenilyn works hard to support her family. Ma. Wenilyn is married and has a cosmetology business in the Philippines.

Ma. Wenilyn requested a PHP 19500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business. Ma. Wenilyn has been in this business for 15 years now. In the future, Ma. Wenilyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 44 years old and married with five children.

Luzviminda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Luzviminda has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 21 years and earns additional income from raising pigs and farming sugarcane.

Luzviminda aspires to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 40 years old and the father of six children age between the ages of three and 13. For the past seven years, he has been a farmer and his farm provides milk and maize for the local market. Julius laments the high costs of production in his area and the unreliable rain.

Julius is requesting a 41,600 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He hopes his increased income will meet his daily family needs and make life more bearable. Julius is focusing on doubling the number of his dairy cows in five years.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a married woman. She has two children with ages ranging from 14 to 22 years old. She describes herself to be jovial and determined. She operates a retail business where she sells cosmetics such as treatments, shampoos, earrings, hair weaves etc. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located in a strategic area and her primary customers are retailers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve his business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more cosmetics to sell. Florence's business goal is to venture into a retail shop and a salon within five years.

loans.use: to add more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 40 years old and has run a  sari-sari (variety) business for the past year and a half. His store is located in front of his house and he also owns a small stall in front of the elementary school in his town where he sells snacks such as banana cue, cassava cakes, sweet potato cue, and chips. Joel earns 3,000 PHP each month.

Joel is requesting a loan to buy pigs and to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and instant noodles. In the future, he plans to start a hog-raising business to augment his income. Joel hopes that his businesses will grow and that his two children will finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods and noodles, and to buy pigs to raise

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 59  years old and is married with six children, the youngest of whom is seven years old. For the past 24 years, he has been a farmer in Kitale, Westen Kenya, and his farm currently produces maize, milk, and horticultural products that he sells at the local market to meet his family's needs. Alfred also works as a carpenter. He says that the main challenge for farmers is accessing loans and he is glad that Juhudi Kilimo is mitigating this challenge.

Alfred is requesting a 52,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He hopes to increase his income to meet his family's needs and plans to buy more land to expand his farm.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Salina

texts.en:
Salina is 49 years old, married and a mother of two children aged 19 and 13 years, respectively. She sells vegetables, a business she started five years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 12,000. She has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase kale and cabbage to sell.

The anticipated profit from the business will help her build rental houses. Her dream is to be successful in life and educate her children in good schools. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase kale and cabbage to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 32 years old and married with four children, all of whom are still in school. She lives in Yei, and has sold fish for the past two years. Agnes heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. 

Agnes is requesting a 500 SDG loan to purchase fish. She will use the extra income from her loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 31-year-old married man with a 9-month-old daughter. For the past four years, he has operated a retail store where he sells items such as maize, rice, blueband, sugar, salt, tea leaves, and other items. His busy store is located in an area that is conducive to business and his primary customers are retailers. John describes himself as determined and honest and his biggest business challenge is the high price of goods.

John is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase more home products to sell such as sugar, maize flour, and beans. His dream is to expand his wholesale shop within the next five years.

loans.use: to buy products such as maize flour, sugar, and beans to sell

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en: Sambath, 40, is married and resides with her husband and two school-age children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling breakfast food and desert for over seven years, earning approximately USD 10 per day. Her husband is a security guard and earns approximately USD 3 per day. In order to improve her family’s economy, Sambath is requesting for a loan of USD 800 to raise capital in her business in order to purchase more food ingredients for producing all kinds of food to sell to her clients. By doing so, she will be able to generate more profit for supporting her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and support her children to study until they get a Bachelor's degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger and bigger to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more food ingredients

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 41 years old and married with two children. She lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. Teresita is engaged in agricultural business growing and selling pigs. She has been in this business for over 10 years. She is not engaged in any other line of business. Teresita is hands-on with her business. The return is quite good. The micro credit requested will be used to purchase feed and medicine for her pigs. Teresita plan to make her business bigger and the income generated will help her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase feed and medicine for pigs

loans.name: Carmen Luisa

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer muy trabajadora,  tiene 59 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, Perú. Pisco se encuentra a sólo 28 metros sobre el nivel del mar y es un destino turístico importante para los peruanos adinerados, a causa de sus viñedos, su producción del Perú la bebida nacional de Pisco, y la proximidad de unas ruinas incas y la Reserva Nacional de Paracas, uno de los más famosos parques nacionales del Perú. Sin embargo, la ciudad estaba muy cerca del epicentro del devastador terremoto de 8,0 grados de magnitud que sacudió el centro sur de Perú en agosto de 2007. Más del 80% de la ciudad fue destruida, y después de varios años, la ciudad y su gente todavía se están recuperando de los daños.  En su tiempo libre disfruta leer libros ya que le ayuda a olvidad cualquier preocupación o si esta de mal humor;  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que a Carmen le gusta mucho es el riquísimo “Caucau”; Carmen estudió hasta quinto año de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Administración. Carmen  es  madre soltera, su hijo tiene 15 años y cursa el quinto grado de educación secundaria.
						
Carmen trabaja en su negocio de venta de artesanías, se dedica a este trabajo 11 horas diarias en la que puede atender hasta 15 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque hay mucho turismo en la zona donde ella ofrece.

Carmen está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella comprar mas mercadería, ello le  permitirá tener más variedad de productos  y así seguir trabajando para cumplir su gran sueño: “Tener su casa propia."
texts.en:
Carmen is 59 years old. She is a very hard-working woman who lives in the city of Pisco, Peru. Pisco is only 28 meters above sea level. It is an important tourist destination for well-off Peruvians, because of its vineyards, its production of pisco (Peru's national drink), and its proximity to Inca ruins and to the Paracas National Reserve, one of the most famous national parks in Peru. 

However, the city was very close to the epicenter of the devastating 8.0 magnitude earthquake that shook south central Peru in August 2007. More than 80% of the city was destroyed, and after several years, the city and its people are still recovering from the damage.

In her free time she enjoys reading books, as they help her forget whatever is worrying her, or if she is in a bad mood. As is well known, Peru has some of the most delicious food in the world, and one of the dishes that Carmen really likes is the very tasty "Caucau" (a stew made with tripe and potatoes). 

Carmen went to school as far as fifth year of secondary, but she would have liked to have studied Administration. Carmen is a single mother. Her son is 15, and in fifth year of secondary school.  

Carmen works in her business selling handicrafts. She does this eleven hours daily, and can serve up to 15 customers a day. She thinks her business is doing well because there is a lot of tourism in the area where she sells.
