The main business challenges for Mary include transportation, thieves and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop and a delivery van to ease in transportation. Mary lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity or to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include paying school fees, rent and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bundles of mats, hand woven caps and baskets.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA SOFIA RADICA EN LA COMUNIDAD DE LA CHILEZA DESDE HACE YA VARIO TIEMPO DEDICANDOSE DURANTE 30 AÑOS A LA ELABORACION Y VENTA DE PAN, ROSQUILLA, QUESADILLAS Y TAMALES SUS VENTAS SON DE MANERA AMBULANTE ESTA SOLICITANDO LPS3.000.00, ESTE DINERO LO NECESITA PARA INVERTIRLO EN COMPRA DE HARINA, HUEVOS, CUAJADA, ETC 
DOÑA SOFIA ES UNA PERSONA EMPRENDEDORA Y CON DESEOS DE SALIR ADELANTE SU SUEÑO ES QUE SU FAMILIA ESTE BIEN. SU META  ES SEGUIR CRECIENDO EN SU NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
Sofia has lived in the community of La Chileza for some time.  For thirty years she has been making and selling bread, donuts, quesadillas and tamales.  She makes her sales as an itinerant vendor.  She is requesting 3,000 lempira which she needs to invest in buying flour, eggs, curds, etc.  

Sofia is an entrepreneurial person who has a desire to get ahead in life.  Her dream is for her family to be well.  Her goal is to continue growing in her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs and other supplies that she uses to make her products

loans.name: Tajy Punta Group

texts.es:
Tajy Punta es denominado el comité y actualmente se encuentra en el 2°ciclo con 13 integrantes, es un grupo de señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras, ellas se dedican diversas actividades, pero también hacen actividades en conjunto para fomentar su compañerismo.
La señora Corina es madre soltera de 4 hijos pequeños y ha luchado mucho para sacarlos adelante y gracias a esta oportunidad brindada por la fundación y por kiva, sabe que podrá salir adelante. Ella es artesana, y se dedica al bordado de sabanas, sobrecamas y demás.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos y telas para el bordado que tiene. Agradece la oportunidad que está recibiendo, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
'Tajy Punta' is the name of this committee who are in their second loan cycle with thirteen members.  This is a group of very responsible and hard-working ladies.  They each work in their own business activity but they also work together to foster team spirit.

Corina is a single mother with four young children.  She has worked hard to provide for them and, thanks to this opportunity from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva, she knows that she will be able to get ahead in life.  Corina is a craftswoman and her business is embroidering sheets, bedspreads, etc.

Corina is requesting a loan to buy fabric and threads for the embroidery that she does.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving as it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy fabric and threads

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.en: Rosa is twenty-seven years old and the mother of two children, ages seven and one. She is a happy and friendly person who loves to work on her embroidery. Rosa learned the craft from her friends and she now works on her pieces full time, creating colorful tablecloths by hand. She works alone and her tablecloths sell well, which is why she hopes to buy more materials with this loan, thus increasing her production and raising her revenues. Rosa's children depend on the income generated from the sale of her pieces, and so she doesn't mind working hard as long as her kids are happy and have a stable life. She dreams of one day earning enough to buy her own home and give her kids a more comfortable life.

loans.use: To buy embroidery materials.

loans.name: Victo

texts.en:
Victo lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, four of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members, her sister's children. 

Victo has as a business a retail shop. She has been in this business for a year, and she works seven days a week. Victo sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Victo has requested a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more boxes of soap, cartons of salt, bags of sugar and jerycans of cooking oil.     

The main business challenges for Victo include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop and a delivery van to ease transportation. Victo lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include paying school fees, rent and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, boxes of soap, cartons of salt and jerycans of cooking oil.

loans.name: Primera Esperanza 1 Group

texts.en:
Mayra is one of the members of her group named Primera Persona 1 (First Person). This is a group made up of five businesspeople women and men, dedicated to doing business all over their rural community, in the city of Hato Mayor. Mayra is a mother of two children and they live together with her and their father. 

For about ten years, Mayra has had a beauty salon which she started with the first loan she took with Esperanza International. She has improved her business with every loan she has taken with Esperanza. This is her sixteenth loan. She plans to use this loan to buy different hair and beauty product lines.

Mayra's story is generally representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. She thanks all of you for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy hair and beauty products.

loans.name: Laura Pastora

texts.en: Laura is a forty-five-year-old married mother of three. She describes herself as a cheerful and energetic person who doesn't mind hard work. She learned to embroider by hand when she was only five-years-old. After many years of practice, she has now honed her skill and is able to produce many beautiful tablecloths and runners. Demand for her work is steady, and she hopes that with this loan, she will be able to improve on the quality of cloth she uses to produce her pieces, and perhaps earn a little more money. She dreams of one day owning her own embroidery shop where she can produce a greater number of pieces in a shorter amount of time.

loans.use: To buy materials for embroidery.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es: EL SEÑOR JUAN MANUEL VIVE CON SU ESPOSA Y SUS 2 HIJOS EN SU CASA DE HABITACION UBICADA EN LA ALDEA LA CHILEZA DEDICANDOSE A VARIAS ACTIVIDADES COMO SER CRIA DE GANADO, FLETES, VENTA DE FRUTAS DE LA EPOCA SOLICITA A PRISMA UN PRESTAMO DE LPS 5,000.00 PARA COMPRA DE SANDIA YA QUE ES LA FRUTA QUE SE DA EN ESTA EPOCA Y QUIERE APROVECHAR LA TEMPORADA. DON JUAN ES UNA PERSONA TRABAJADORA DEDICADA A SU TRABAJO DESEA INVERTIR EN SU NEGOCIO YA QUE ENTRE MAS LE INVIERTE MEJORES SON SUS UTILIDADES. EL SUEÑO DE DON JUAN ES MEJORAR SUS CONDICIONES DE VIDA Y LAS DE SU FAMILIA.
texts.en: Juan Manuel lives with his wife and two children in their home which is located in the small village of La Chileza.  He carries out a number of different business activities such as raising livestock, providing transportation services and selling seasonal fruit.  He is requesting a loan for 5,000 lempira from Prisma to buy watermelons as they are in season right now and he wants to make the most of this.  Juan is a hard-working person who is committed to his work.  He would like to invest in his business because the more he invests, the greater his profits are.  Juan's dream is to improve his own living conditions as well as those of his family.

loans.use: to make the most of harvest season and stock up with watermelons

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria  tiene 21 años es soltera, vive con sus padres en la compañía Tajy Loma de la Ciudad Carapeguá.
Ella es tejedora y macatera, desde muy joven se dedica a estos dos trabajos que le deja un buen ingreso, aprendió a tejer con su mamá,  ya que ésta se dedica hace 25 años a dicha profesión, y suele ir de macate con su papá, por la ciudad de Formosa, donde viajan a llevar sus productos a vender. 
Vende también sus productos por Carapeguá ya que estos son   de muy buena calidad. Sus vecinos dicen que es responsable y trabajadora, valores importantes para el progreso.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos, colores, trapos para tejer, ya que los necesita para poder trabajar. Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo por parte de kiva y fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
Maria is 21 years old and single.  She lives with her parents in Tajy Loma, in the city of Carapeguá.

Maria is a weaver and rural saleswoman.  She has been in these two businesses since she was very young and they make her good income.  She learned to weave from her mom who has been in this business for 25 years and she usually goes out selling with her dad in the town of Formosa.  They travel there with their products to sell.  

Maria also sells her products in Carapeguá as they are very good quality.  Her neighbors say that she is responsible and hard-working, which are important values for making progress.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy threads, dyes and rags for her weaving as she needs them to be able to work.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, rags, etc.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en: Guadalupe is a 36-year-old mother of two.  She is a very happy and optimistic person who works hard to provide for her family.  She makes a living embroidering tablecloths and table runners by hand, and selling them from her stand in Otavalo, Ecuador.  Her mom taught her the craft when Guadalupe was fifteen years old, and she has been doing it professionally ever since.  Her sales have gone well so far, which is why she hopes to purchase a greater quantity of better quality materials with this loan.  Guadalupe dreams of one day owning a store from which to sell her pieces, and to make enough money to send her kids to college.

loans.use: To buy materials for embroidery.

loans.name: Maria Ernestina

texts.en: Maria is a 24-year-old hardworking single mother.  She sells "mote", or cooked corn kernels, a traditional Ecuadorian snack food.  Maria began this line of work years ago, when she would help her mother with her mote sales.  She works alone and so far is doing well, but wants to increase her income by purchasing some pigs in order to raise and sell them later.  Maria hopes that with the extra money she will be able to afford a stall where she can cook and sell greater quantities of mote, and to provide her customers with a nicer space where they can enjoy her food.  Maria dreams of earning enough money from her sales of food and pigs that she will be able to purchase a small home where she can live with her family.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  Nulu has a business of selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 3 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. She sells her products from home, by means of retail. 

Nulu has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. The main business challenges for Nulu include transportation, thieves and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale business and a delivery van to ease transportation. Nulu lives in a home that she owns where she has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include paying school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Maria Irene

texts.en: Maria is a 29-year-old mother of four.  She describes herself as an honest and energetic person who works hard in order to provide for her children.  She learned to embroider by hand about ten years ago from her friends, and she now creates tablecloths and runners which she then sells.  Although her business is doing well, Maria would like to increase her output, and wants to use the money from this loan to buy more materials of better quality.  With the money she will hopefully earn from future sales, she plans to fix up the little home she shares with her family.

loans.use: To buy materials for embroidery.

loans.name: Rayo De Luz 3 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group Rayo de Luz (Ray of Light) 3. Her group is located in the areas surrounding La Romana, an area economically dominated by the sugarcane harvest. She makes her home here in a simple structure with five of her six children. A widowed mother for many years, Maria said that her important challenge is to maintain their honesty; she enjoys her work and sharing the benefits at home with her family.

Maria is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. She has a food stand, where she sells different sandwiches and Pica pollo (fried chicken with potatoes or plantain) and she will buy bread, meat, plantain, cooking oil, eggs, ham and cheese, etc. She will use the profits to save and reinvest in her business.  She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy bread, meat, plantains and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mata De Palma En Desarrollo 3, 5 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Carmen is the coordinator of the group Mata de Palma en Desarrollo (which means: 'palm tree in development'). The group is named after the community where it is located, in Hato Mayor city, in the eastern part of the country. Hato Mayor is a fairly mountainous region where the principal industry is agriculture.

Carmen is a mother of four children and they live together with her and their father. She said that her most difficult challenge has been to create her business. In the past it was very difficult, because she did not have enough money to start one up, but after she found Esperanza and took out her loans, she was able (like other members in this group) to open her business.

Carmen is excited about her thirteenth loan with Esperanza. After almost seven years in her business, she has expanded her little butcher shop into a bigger one, with more quantity of meats to supply more clients. With this loan she will increase her inventory and make even bigger sales. She will use the profits to invest in her butcher shop and she will start to save part of it to make one of her dreams come true: to start building her house. She dreams of having a nice house and a successful business with employees. Carmen and her group thank all of you for your support. 

There are three photos to complete this group of 15 members because this pictures were taken in their community and we try to make visible as many faces as possible.

loans.use: to buy meat such as pork, beef and bacon.

loans.name: La Honradez 5 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group, La Honradez (The Honesty) group 5. This group is located in the rural area surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy. 

She is a married mother who lives together to her husband and their three children. To earn a living, she operates miscellaneous sales business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying pants, t-shirts, blouses, shoes, accessories, and cosmetic products. She says that her most difficult challenge was to save enough money to start her business. In the meantime, she plans to continue to enjoy attending the church. 

Maria is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza. She has been saving her profits because, through this business, she wants to make one of her dreams come true: to have a successful business, with which she can be able to have a safer home and provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Edith Margoth

texts.en: Edith is thirty-eight years old and has three children, aged six, nine and sixteen, who she is raising on her own. She is a strong woman who likes to do right by those around her, and she works hard harvesting potatoes and lima beans in order to provide for herself and her kids. Although her income hasn't always been steady, things have gotten better in recent years, and Edith hopes to take advantage of the upturn by investing in her crops while they are profitable. Her dream is that in a few years, if things continue the way they are, she can expand her trade to animal farming, something which would undoubtedly raise the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: To buy materials to harvest potatoes.

loans.name: Armonia Y Triunfo Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Carmela, tiene 41 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales dos son mayores de edad, ellos son su razon y motivo de superación.
Desde hace tres años la Sra. Carmela se dedica a su bodega, inició éste negocio debido a que su suegra quien tenía a cargo ésta bodega fué afectada por un derrame cerebral, lo que causó que la bodega fracazara, con la motivación de su esposo y para apoyarlo en los gastos de la casa ella se dedico a levantar el negocio, poco a poco fué creciendo y aumentando sus productos, empezó solo con golosinas, luego invirtió un poco en abarrotes, luego en bebidas y ahora quiere invertir el prestamo recibido en la compra de perfumes y asi surtir un poco mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmela is 41 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are adults.  They are her reason and motivation to do well in life.

Carmela has been running a small store for three years.  She started this business because her mother-in-law, who previously ran the store, suffered a brain hemorrhage which caused the store to fail.  With her husband's encouragement, and in order to support him with their household expenses, Carmela started work building the business back up.  She gradually grew the business and increased the variety of products she sold.  She started out only selling candies then invested a little in groceries, then in drinks.  Now she would like to invest her loan in buying perfumes so that she can stock the business a little further.

loans.use: to invest in buying perfumes for her store

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en: Shadi is a 20-year-old Lebanese single man. He’s living with his parents and four siblings. He cooperates with his father in order to satisfy their family needs. Shadi has owned a clothing shop since 2008 and has his own loyal customers. Today, he’s requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new clothes collection for his shop. He notes that this loan will certainly push him to get higher returns. In the future, he plans to open other branches of his shop.

loans.use: to purchase a new clothes collection for his shop

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 23-year-old Lebanese single man. He’s living with his parents and only one sibling who is still studying. His father is working really hard to offer a suitable life for his family. 

Abbas opened his own gadgets and balloon shop in 2009. Today, he’s in need of a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added materials for his business such as helium, balloons and many other accessories, in order to diversify his items, boost his sales and gain a new range of customers. This will surely increase his profits. In the future, he plans to open other branches in different areas.

loans.use: to purchase added materials for his business such as helium, balloons and many other accessories.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 25 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. He is the main source of income in the family and works hard to provide a better future for his children. 

Abdallah started his own metal and construction equipment trade business in 2008. He is requesting a youth loan from Ameen s.a.l., which he will use to purchase metal supplies and construction tools for his shop. He believes that this loan will increase his profits by 20%. In the future, he plans to expand his business in order to earn superior income.

loans.use: to purchase metal supplies and construction tools for his shop.

loans.name: Rida

texts.en: Rida is a 22-year-old man. He’s Lebanese, single, living with his parents and two siblings; one of them is working. He strives to work hard with the cooperation of his father, in order to fulfill their family demands.  He has six years of experience in the construction field and works on a free-lance basis. Today, he’s asking for a youth loan from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new Bobcat and a truck for his work. This loan will facilitate his business operations and allow him to carry on his job properly. In the future, he plans to buy new and full-options equipment and take bigger projects.

loans.use: to purchase a new Bobcat and a truck for his work.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 26-year-old Lebanese engaged man who lives with his parents and two working siblings. After finding it hard to cover his family expenses, he decided to double his efforts and combine forces with his brother. 

Youssef started his own work as a painter in 2006, on a free-lance basis. He’s a reputable man, known for his good and well organized work. Today, he’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a minivan for his business.  This Kiva loan will facilitate his transportation, especially when visiting his customers at home. In the future, he plans to open his own painting shop.

loans.use: to purchase a minivan for his business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 1 child, who is in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her in-laws). She has a business of selling bunches of green bananas.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. She sells her products at the market, by means of retail.  

Lydia has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas.  Her main business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and to build rental rooms.

She lives in a home that she owns where she has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include paying school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas is a 24-year-old Lebanese man. He’s married and lives with his wife and one child who is still attending school. He’s the one responsible for covering his family expenses and paying his child’s educational fees.  He has been working in the construction field for the past five years.  He’s expert in this domain and has gained a fair number of clients so far. Today, he needs to borrow a youth loan from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new construction tools. This loan will facilitate his business operations and augment his revenues. In the future, he plans to open his own construction office and take bigger projects.

loans.use: to purchase new construction tools

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 28 years old. She lives in Ijevan with her jobless mother. Anna graduated from the Ijevan branch of Yerevan State University where she has acquired a profession of philologist. 

Because Anna’s father is dead, she was forced to keep her family with herself. Therefore she has two occupations. She works as a secretary in one of Ijevan’s organizations, and she also runs her own business. She sells clothes directly from her house. This fact allows her to save on stall rent. Every month she buys merchandise from wholesale markets in Yerevan. Anna makes an emphasis on children's clothes, as she says that those goods are always in popular demand. She has a lot of regular customers, and she knows their tastes very well, so she tries to buy merchandise according to their requirements.
  
Her business allows her to keep her small family, and she intends to develop her trading. She needs a 500,000 AMD loan to buy various spring clothes, house slippers, baby sets, etc. to resell. This is Anna's second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: to buy various spring clothes, house slippers, baby sets, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro de 56 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y tiene 6 hijos en las edades de 11 a 30 años. Desde hace 5 años, cuando estaba pasando una situación económica muy difícil, después de haber trabajado como albañil y no encontraba como ejercer este oficio,   consultó a su esposa el hacer un primer ejercicio de producir chancletas para venderlas y generar ingresos, ella apoyó esta idea y por eso Pedro prestó dinero a un amigo, compró materias primas y elaboró  unas pocas sandalias que le generaron  ingresos básicos;   a sus clientes le gustaron y empezaron a recomendarlo, por eso su clientela empezó a crecer, mientras él observando  los pies de quien pasaba por su lado todo el que veía,  agregaba el modelo observado a sus diseños. Con el apoyo de su cónyuge, y especialmente el financiamiento  de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, logró aumentar su capital de trabajo, crecer y estabilizarse;  con esta organización ha  recibido 2 financiamientos, durante 3 años que le han ayudado. Hoy quiere crecer aun más y está solicitando un credikiva para comprar materias primas e insumos y fabricar modelos, comprando en mayor volumen espumas láminas de suelas, pegantes forros, tacones etc. Su meta mas adelante es tener un local comercial donde exhibir sus productos, comprar maquinarias más especializadas con los que hacer efectiva su producción y continuar mejorando el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: 56-year-old Pedro lives with his wife and has six children who are between 11 and 30 years of age.  Five years ago, Pedro was experiencing a very difficult financial situation.  He worked as a builder but was not finding work.  He discussed with his wife the idea of making thongs (flip-flops) to sell and thereby make money.  She supported this idea and so Pedro borrowed money from a friend, bought raw materials and made a few pairs of sandals which made him a small amount of money.  His customers liked his products and started to recommend him.  His customer base started to grow and he looked closely at the feet of people as they passed by, adding ideas to his designs.  With the support of his wife and especially thanks to his loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, Pedro managed to increase his working capital, grow his business and stabilize it.  He has received two loans from this organization who have helped him for three years.  Pedro would like to grow his business even further and is requesting a Kiva loan to buy raw materials and supplies so that he can make his products.  He will buy foam, soles, adhesive, lining, heels etc.  His goal for the future is to have sales premises where he can display his products.  He would also like to buy more specialized machinery, which would make his production more efficient, and continue improving his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies for making his products.  He will buy foam, soles, adhesive, lining, heels, etc.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia is a single mother of two children, ages 3 and 7.  She describes herself as a strong woman who works very hard to make ends meet and provide for her kids.  She learned machine sewing about five years ago, and has been doing it as a full time job ever since, making bedding and sewing pillowcases.  

She currently works alone, but with this, her first loan, she wants to buy a second sewing machine with which to increase her production, and find a helper to work with her.  Silvia's vision of the future includes purchasing many more machines and hiring more people, providing work for others and bettering her children's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy more sewing machines.
